Take heart, Alliance!  Throw these villains from Alterac Valley!
Die!  Your kind has no place in Alterac Valley!
Begone, uncouth scum!  The Alliance shall prevail in Alterac Valley!
I allow the man to take enough corn to feed his family for a couple of days, encouraging him to leave the land.
I confiscate the corn he has stolen, warn him that stealing is a path towards doom and destruction, but I let him go to return to his family.
I turn over the man to my liege for punishment, as he has broken the law of the land and it is my sworn duty to enforce it.
I slay the man on the spot as my liege would expect me to do, as he is nothing more than a thief and a liar.
I am ready to discover where my fortune lies!

Ragefire Chasm can be found beneath the Shadow Cleft in the center of Orgrimmar.

Once the greatest gold production center in the human lands, the Dead Mines are now inhabited by the Defias Brotherhood, who have turned the dark tunnels into their private sanctum. It is rumored that the thieves have conscripted the clever goblins to help them build something terrible at the bottom of the mines - but what that may be is still uncertain. Rumor has it that the way into the Deadmines lies through the quiet, unassuming village of Moonbrook.

Ragefire Chasm consists of a network of volcanic caverns below the orcs' new capital city of Orgrimmar. Recently, rumors have spread that a cult loyal to the demonic Shadow Council has taken up residence within the Chasm's fiery depths. This cult, known as the Burning Blade, threatens the very sovereignty of Durotar. Many believe that the orc Warchief Thrall is aware of the Blade's existence and has chosen not to destroy it in the hopes that its members might lead him straight to the Shadow Council.
At last, the agony ends. I have failed you my Queen. I have failed us all...

A large humanoid hand print is embedded on the surface of the orb. Despite what appears to be constant manipulation and handling, the orb remains unmarred.

Gorzeeki tells me that you have brought him all that he needs for the Bell of Dethmoora, the Wheel of the Black March and the Doomsday Candle.$B$BWell done, $N!  You are almost ready to perform your ritual and bind a dreadsteed!

To summon a Dreadsteed, you must first create a Circle of Greater Summoning.  A portal to Xoroth may only be created from within such a circle.$B$BThe Circle of Greater Summoning requires three powerful implements: a Bell of Dethmoora, a Wheel of the Black March and a Doomsday Candle.

Do I look like a fool, mortal? Because only a fool would remain here and do battle with you and all of your allies. Perhaps another time... Should you ever find the courage to back up your banter.

Officers' Lounge
I am not fooled by your disguise, temptress. Your time to die has come.
So you are Klinfran the Crazed? Sad, I was expecting an actual challenge. Do you dare face me in your true form?
A gnome? How pathetic. Face me, demon!

The officers' lounge
How wonderful to see another person in this remote region of the world. Come, walk with me. Let our bodies keep each other warm.
I come to Silithus every year around this time. The weather is phenomenal for my bunions.$B$BYou should take a stroll with me, friend. Enjoy the sights and what not.
Lava? Pay no mind to all of that, friend. Look around you. Take in the joys that nature has to offer.
You are mine, dreadsteed!  Your spirit is now bound to me!
It's no lie, traitor.  Banehollow wants your heart, and I'm going to get it for him.
No, Ulathek.  He knows your secret.  He knows you plot with Lord Hel'nurath of Xoroth.
Dreadlords?  Perhaps you mean Lord Banehollow.  He sends his regards, and has a message for you...
You dog!  Now I'll trap your soul into a shard and give you to my imp as a plaything!
I wish to purchase from you.
The ways of Jaedenar are dark and treacherous.  Watch your moves in this place, $C, or you will find your soul entralled by your rivals...
The spirit of the Dreadsteed pulses with rage.
You dare interfere with this being's test? The battle must be fought alone! You shall all suffer for this indiscretion.

You must do what I could not: Save the peasants that were cut down while fleeing from Stratholme.$B$BThey will walk towards the light, you must ensure their survival. Should too many fall, our cursed existence shall continue - you will have failed.$B$BEvery ability, prayer, and spell that you have learned will be tested. May the Light protect you, $N.
So what can I do to help?

I never stated that you were here to redeem yourself, $g priest:priestess;. You are here to redeem me and the innocents murdered while trying to escape Stratholme.$B$BMy spirit and the spirit of those lost are bound here, cursed to endlessly relive our own tragic deaths.
Those days are over, Eris.

I know you will, $N.$B$BI myself am a priestess, though, unlike you I am long since gone from this world. My spirit, however, remains here, as do the spirits of the thousands who were brutally slain by the mad Prince, Arthas Menethil and his legion of undeath.
I really did not know what to expect, Eris. I will use my powers to assist you if that is what is asked of me.

You were. The Eye is never wrong.$B$BYou are a $g priest:priestess;, after all. A powerful $g priest:priestess;, if the Eye showed you this horrible memory.$B$BYou have come for redemption, yet you yourself do not even realize this... Do you?
And I was suited to see this?
<Eris nods.>$B$BThe Eye has seen so many horrors and so many wonders.$B$BIt displays what it feels the one looking into it is most suited to see.
The Eye led me here, Eris.
Stratholme is no more! The city lies in ruins. The Prince consumed by hatred... madness...
Seek sanctuary in the Hearthglen! It is our only hope!
Too many have fallen, $g priest:priestess;. You must focus!
Until then, I shall take my leave...
$N, summon me again when you need to perform the ritual again.
But wait...
Praise the Light, one has finally answered the calling.
Balai Lok'Wein of Brackenwall Village in Dustwallow Marsh sells a manual that you will need to study in order to improve your skills!
Only the renowned Doctor Gregory Victor can improve your skill now.  He can be found in Arathi Highlands at Hammerfall.
It's my way or the Gold Road.  Is that understood?
Clean this place up! We will not live in such squalor.
Stop whining!
You are mine now children.  You will grow up to be a strong part of the horde!
I believe you children are our future...
All will be well children.  The Light shall see to that!
Now children stop that!  I mean it!
It's so sad for you poor children.
Wulan in Shadowprey Village can sell you the "Expert Cookbook".  You will need that if you are to better yourself.
Cooking is a life long pursuit and I see we share the same passion!
Seek out Shandrina in Silverwind Refuge.  She can sell you the "Expert Cookbook".
Death take me! I cannot go on! I have nothing left...
The pain is unbearable!
I won't make it... go... go on without me...
Well what do you know, this is Children's Week!  What can I do to help?
The Week of the Wardens is not yet over... may I have another Orphan Whistle?
Chief Bloodhoof, this may sound like an odd request... but I have a young ward who is quite shy.  You are a hero to him, and he asked me to get your hoofprint.
Lady Jaina, this may sound like an odd request... but I have a young ward who is quite shy.  You are a hero to him, and he asked me to get your autograph.
Be healed, $g priest:priestess;.
The power of the light is truly great and merciful.
Stranger, find the fallen Prince Menethil and end his reign of terror.
We shall be reunited once more, my love...
Thank you, kind stranger. May your heroism never be forgotten.

YOU ARE THE LOSE!
YOU ARE THE WINNER!
PEASANT CROSSES LINE.
Give me the contract.

You see, all you gotta do is forge the Sulfuron hammer and find yourself the Eye of Sulfuras. Combine the Eye of Sulfuras with the Sulfuron hammer and it will become Sulfuras! Now I'm not going to bog you down with any technical information as to where or how or when you can get an Eye of Sulfuras. I'm sure you'll figure that stuff out. Just sign this here contract so that our agreement is binding and our business will be done.
You've got my attention.

In exchange for one Sulfuron Ingot, I am authorized to grant you one copy of the plans to forge a Sulfuron hammer.$B$BNow an adventurer like yourself is probably thinking to $g himself:herself;, "What would I ever need a hammer like that for when what I already own is far superior?"$B$BWell let me tell you something, $g mister:missy;, there ain't nothing more superior than what the Sulfuron hammer can become!
Hrm, I'm listening. What is this offer?

A Sulfuron ingot?!??! Impossible! I must have it! I must! I must!$B$B$R, I am authorized to make you a grand deal for that ingot. Perhaps you would be interested to know the secrets of the Hand of Ragnaros? Sulfuras, idiot! The legendary hammer of the Firelord.
How do I do that?
This is all very interesting but what is it that you want?
What task?
I am in search of a great and powerful Warlock.
Awe inspiring, master. Your ineptitude is awe inspiring.
Oh my, what a surprise! Another failure!? But how, oh great one??
Kick me out, will they!? I'll show those uptight cone heads in Stormwind the true power of Niby! BEHOLD!
Brace yourself for the glorious impact, Impsy!
We must first craft a prison to confine the beast, if you wish to progress further.
How can I conjure a demon?
That will be the choice of the demon you wish to conjure and enslave. We wield dark powers and we pay grossly for the use of said powers.
What would I sacrifice?
So, you have found me. I suppose that you have come to learn of suppression and control.$B$BI will teach you much more than that... you will also learn of sacrifice.$B$B<Daio grins.>
I have come to learn, Daio.
A sacrifice will be due if I am ever called upon, mortal...
Gorzeeki, I wish to make a purchase.

The fissure closed and Krixix was gone! Swallowed whole!$B$BBe warned, $r, what you wish for could very well become that which you do not want. You play with beings and arcana that are older than time itself!$B$BShould Krixix be alive and should he have the information which you seek, you can be certain that he will not give up said information. He has faced terrors far worse than you could ever dream to perpetrate.
So what happened?

Aye, he had done what was thought to be impossible. Out from the fissure sprung an agent of Therazane!$B$BFrom my vantage point, I could see the goblin holding conversation with the agent of the Old God. What happened after that was terrible...
A fissure?

A former student of mine by the name of Krixix spent a lifetime attempting to make contact with the chained Gods of the underworld. He pursued that which would spring up from the ravaged earth... That which would form only as a result of the elements clashing in titanic conflict.$B$BElementium as it would be known to mortals.$B$BOne day, nearly a decade ago, Krixix's pursuit lead to a fissure forming in this very gorge.
What do you know of it, Franzahl?
Elementium? I have not heard that word uttered from the mouth of a mortal in decades.
Are you the Earthshaper capable of creating Elementium?
Summon forth your cowardly master, fool! Let him face me!
<Demitrian laughs.>$B$BYour reward is a quick and painful death, fool!
Ah, and the fool who freed me shall be among the first to quell my immense hunger.

Well done, servant. For so long I have been held captive within the prison of the Firelord. I am once more free to feast upon the out world! The land shall once more be ravaged by the force of the Wind Seeker!
The Syndicate keeps many locked boxes of supplies in Durnholde Keep in Hillsbrad.
The Venture Company based around Windshear Crag in Stonetalon keeps their supplies in locked boxes.
Many locked supply boxes were lost when the Naga overran the Zoram Strand in Ashenvale.
Many locked boxes of supplies were sunk by the orcs in Lake Everstill in Redridge.
The Scarlet Crusade of Tyr's Hand in the Eastern Plaguelands have many lockboxes that will challenge your skill.
Both Lost Rigger Cove in Tanaris and the Bay of Storms in Azshara have boxes that can be picked to improve your skill.
The Dark Iron dwarves of the Slag Pit in Searing Gorge have a great number of locked boxes.
The Pool of Tears in the Swamp of Sorrows holds ancient locked boxes that were lost in another age.
The waters of northern Sar'theris Strand in Desolace or the Angor Fortress in Badlands have locked boxes that can be picked open.
Bluegill Marsh north of Menethil Harbor in the Wetlands holds many locked boxes from the wrecks offshore that have washed ashore.
Where can I go to improve my lockpicking?
Your challenge has failed!
Give me the vessel, Highlord.

The corporeal form of Ragnaros must be destroyed. From the remnants, his essence shall emerge. In this weakened state, Ragnaros' grip on the prison of Thunderaan is loosed. The essence itself acting as a key...
I shall scour the earth for this Earthshaper. What of the essence?

The vessel of rebirth must be fortified with elementium. I know of only one source of the mineral: the elemental planes, at the core of our world.$B$BThere is one, an Earthshaper, who may know more than I about the acquisition of such things. You must find this Earthshaper!
The Firelord and all who dare stand in my way shall reel from my wrath.
I hold the vessel of his rebirth. Should you be prepared to take on this task, you will be required to fortify the vessel and ultimately, break the hold of Ragnaros himself!
What must be done?
<Demitrian falls to his knees.>$B$BYou have recovered my Master's eternal prison!$B$BOh long have I waited for this day and finally, it is realized.$B$BHe must be released!
Speak with me, $N - if you are willing, the Cenarion Circle would eagerly accept your generous offer of aid.  The threat posed by the Felvine of Eldre'Thalas is indeed dire.
What would you have me do, Rabine?

I... cannot begin to imagine, $N.  All I know is that I am not going to allow it to happen.  It will be destroyed - if not for our continued safety from demonic taint, then for the memory of Millicent Serene... Milli...$B$BThis, my friend, this is where I hope you will come in.
What would happen if the Fruit of Fertility - or the Felvine - was allowed to be fully corrupted?

Alas, it always seems like it does.  I - as did the rest of the Cenarion Circle - had assumed that Milli's creation was destroyed during the War of the Ancients.  This, as I have come to learn, is far from correct.$B$BThe Fruit of Fertility survived... though now it is known as the Felvine.  It is being corrupted by the demonic lord of that section of Eldre'Thalas, Alzzin the Wildshaper.
But something went wrong, didn't it?

In ages past, Eldre'Thalas was a nexus of magical power, and those who dwelt within its hallowed halls wielded immense power.  One such night elf was Millicent Serene - a naturalist who willed the power of nature itself into potent artifacts she forged.$B$BThe Fruit of Fertility was her crowning achievement... she used a specially prepared moonwell to grow an exotic and vibrant vine that was imbued with an aura of protection and growth.  All of Eldre'Thalas flourished from its existence.
The Fruit of Fertility?

Agents of the Cenarion Circle have uncovered disturbing information pertaining to the current situation in Eldre'Thalas.  I am at an impasse as to what to do about it, and I will no doubt soon seek the aid of able bodied beings capable of handling themselves in a fight.$B$BTo properly take action in Eldre'Thalas, however, is to understand the lore of an object known as the Fruit of Fertility.
Why do you say that this is a coincidence, Rabine?

Aye, but I know it by its true name - Eldre'Thalas.  It was a bastion of magical power for the night elves many, many years ago.$B$BYou know of Eldre'Thalas, young one?  One might say that is coincidental to my current plight... but I am one not to believe in coincidence.
Have you ever heard of a place called Dire Maul?
Serge I have lost the cure to the Touch of Zanzil! HELP!
I've lost the cure, Doc! Tell me you got more!!!
Nathanos, I have lost the rotten apple. I require another.
Lexlort, I lost the thorium shackles.
I have no time for interruptions.
Maybe... What do I do now?
Have you heard of the brood mother of the Black Flight? I believe she is called Onyxia...
Eh?

What I offer to you now is one such blade, unfired, unheated, untreated - the most raw and basic form.$B$BNow you merely need to find a dragon that will willingly enchant the blade.$B$BIf you had an eternity to live, this might be a possibility; but since you are mortal and could very likely cease to exist at any moment, might I recommend trying to persuade one of the lesser dragons to do your bidding.
(Continue.)

Rumors exist of a single, legendary blade of Quel'Serrar crafted for an unknown entity by the combined might of the five Aspects. Before the abominations of Nefarian and Deathwing were thrust into our world, such meetings of the Aspect were represented by the term 'Prismatic.' I could only assume that the Prismatic Blade of Quel'Serrar was a most glorious creation.

Over the course of 8,000 years, only a handful of these blades were created - each blade unique in both power and appearance. The blades of Quel'Serrar would take on the characteristics of their creator.

The blade itself had to be crafted in ceremony with the children of the Aspects. A rare occurrence indeed... For not only would a dragon have to willingly heat and mold the enchanted metal with their breath, they would also need to contain the fury of their own enchantment by using their blood as temper.
Fascinating, Lorekeeper. Continue please.
<Lydros reaches into his robe and presents you with a dull, flat elven blade.>$B$BIn ages past, well before even the War of the Ancients, there existed this blade.
I will not be lured from this place.
Imbecile! Have you not learned the Dewey Decimal System? It has been 3,000 years since you began working for us! Incompetent buffoon.
When will they learn?
Down goes Frazier!  Down goes Frazier! Down goes...huh?  That wasn't Frazier?
Looks like Skarr has found his next challenger!  Wouldn't want to be in that poor fool's shoes!
It's time for the main event!  Skarr the Unbreakable is in the Maul!
The Razza just made more fertilizer for Mushgog!
Woohoo! They are into it now!
Can that be The Razza down there in the Maul?  This is going to be exciting!
Look at that!  Someone is fighting Mushgog!
Holy Cow!  That is Mushgog down there in The Maul.
You honor us with your presence, my lord.
Cho'Rush die! NOW YOU DIE!
<You are well versed in the creation and function of this robot.>
<The complicated schematics are too much for your meager engineering talents to discern.>
<Copy the schematic into your engineering notebook.>
<Drawn out on this parchment is the schematic for a field repair robot.>
<You cannot comprehend any of the technical mumbo jumbo on this scroll.>
This sounds like a task worthy of the new king!
I guess so!
Where is "Garona: A Study in Stealth and Treachery!" These texts must be returned!

Oh the drama and fuss the young Master exerted. You would think the fate of the world rested squarely on his shoulders. Only mortals could have such a skewed perspective on our world.$B$BAlas, he left me with his meager magical secrets... Librams or some such nonsense. I have no use for these paultry magics but perhaps you might be interested in their enchantments.
What you must understand is that being able to index 10,000 years of existence has given me a rather unique perspective on life. Your present day trials and tribulations are meaningless.

So... you took out the King eh?  I knew that these bozos would make you the new king, I just knew it!  That's all these bozos understand - power.$B$BIt would seem that the more henchmen you keep alive, the higher your tribute will be.  Not to shabby - makes for an interesting challenge I'd say.  If you leave, I wouldn't expect to remain king.  One of these yokels will no doubt step up and take your place.$B$BOne more thing... you didn't happen to find my key, did you?
If you not talk to Mizzle, you not become da king!  Take to Mizzle da Crafty!
"The Arcanist's Cookbook" is also gone! This is a disaster!
Oh dear, where is the "Codex of Defense?" Lydros will be most assuredly displeased.

Even if I did, fool, do you think I'd just let you take it from me?  The only way you'd ever get it - if I did possess it - is to pry it from my cold, dead fingers.$B$BThat, my little friend, will not be happening any time soon.
So... you wouldn't happen to have a chest around here that has, let's say, a gauntlet that the Gordok ogres consider to be a priceless artifact?
So, now that I'm the king... what have you got for me?!
Our forces are poised for battle, and eager to spill the blood of the Alliance.  Soon our captain will enter Iceblood Garrison and the war will begin anew!
Mourn the great loss.
It's good to be the king!  Now, let's get back to what you were talking about before...
Henchmen?  Tribute?
The Frostwolf Quartermaster is southwest of this bunker.  Enter the bunker and then exit on the right, you'll see the quartermaster a short way down the path.
The Stormpike Quatermaster keeps his supplies under an awning, just west of here.
Where is the Stormpike Quartermaster?

When our supplies are high, Warmaster Garrick is stationed in the Field of Strife at a catapult, north of Iceblood Garrison.
When our supplies are high, Field Marshal Teravaine is stationed in the Field of Strife, at our southernmost ballista emplacement.
Where is Warmaster Garrick?
Where is Field Marshal Teravaine?
Tharnariun, I have lost the trap. Could you please give me another?
Here are the orders, $N.  Now, take them quickly to Field Marshal Teravaine!
Here are the orders, $N.  Take them quickly to Warmaster Garrick!
Er... that's how I found them.  I wanted to show the king that they were a threat!  Say Captain... I overheard Guard Fengus calling you a fat, useless gnoll lover!
Do I see them with weapons still?  Why you let them keep their weapons?!
Um, I'm taking some prisoners we found outside before the king for punishment.
What you doin' wanderin' around here?  Why them small fries not in da shackles?!
I suppose I can teach that to you.  You'll probably only be able to find ogre tannin here, but the other things you can find most anywhere!
Hey Knot - I'm a Tailor.  Think you could teach me how to make the ogre suit?
Hey Knot - I'm a Leatherworker.  Think you could teach me how to make the ogre suit?
Call me "Boss".  What have you got for me!

I am, am I?  Well what have you got for the new big dog of Gordok, Fengus?
A very sad tale. Thank you, spirit.
We live in a world of endless tragedy.
I'm going to have to kill something, aren't I?
Fascinating. Continue, please.
Continue, please.
I know very little of the Highborne and nothing of the Shen'dralar.

Apply the Gordok war paint!
What do you mean, buy?!  I'm the king now... and it's good to be the king!
Show me what hooch you've got to sell, Kreeg.
THIS EVENT IS WORKING.

Well, from what I've gathered while waiting to be eaten by these yokels... it might not be necessary to kill every ogre you find here.$B$BThe ogres were going on and on the other day about how King Gordok came to power; specifically, he killed the previous king and took his place.  Well, the king's henchmen - those that Gordok spared - immediately swore fealty to the new king.$B$BWho knows - the ogre you save could very well be your own... figuratively speaking, of course!

I'm the new king?  What are you talking about?
Prepare to meet your maker.
DIE!
Mark my words, I will catch you, imp. And when I do!
Why you little...
Game? Are you crazy?
Do you want to play a game, stinky?
You big boss now!  You king!  All hail King $N, King of Gordok!$B$BNow that you da boss, all henchmen will give you tribute!  You left some alive, yeah boss?
You found a key?  Well, is it THE key?  I mean, is it the key to unlock these shackles?  Well $G sir : ma'am;, there is only one way to find out!
So, I found this shackle key...
Tell me of Frostwolf Keep.
Tell me of Dun Baldar.

Frostwolf Keep lies in the south corner of Alterac Valley and protects Frostwolf Village, home of orc clan of the same name.  All Horde territories in Alterac Valley stem from this one place of power.$B$BFrostwolf Keep was razed and is under reconstruction.

Frostwolf Keep lies in the south corner of Alterac Valley and protects Frostwolf Village, home of orc clan of the same name.  All Horde territories in Alterac Valley stem from this one place of power.$B$BFrostwolf Keep is intact.

Dun Baldar is the strongest point of Alliance power in Alterac Valley.  Nestled in the northern reaches of the valley, Dun Baldar is the staging ground  for all advances to the south.$B$BDun Baldar was razed and is under reconstruction.

Dun Baldar is the strongest point of Alliance power in Alterac Valley.  Nestled in the northern reaches of the valley, Dun Baldar is the staging ground for all advances to the south.$B$BDun Baldar is intact.
So what did Ragnaros do next?

A battle?

Captain Galvangar is the trusted aid to Drek'Thar.  He leads the Horde forces from the Iceblood Garrison, in the southern section of the the Field of Strife.$B$BCaptain Galvangar is currently in the Iceblood Garrison.

Drek'Thar is the military and spiritual leader of the Frostwolf Clan in Alterac, leading his brethren from Frostwolf Keep.$B$BIf he is defeated then the Horde forces in Alterac will crumble.

Drek'Thar is the military and spiritual leader of the Frostwolf Clan in Alterac, leading his brethren from Frostwolf Keep.$B$BIf he is defeated then the Horde forces in Alterac will crumble.$B$BDrek'Thar is not currently in Alterac Valley.

Vanndar Stormpike is the general of the Alliance military in Alterac, and directs his forces from Dun Baldar.$B$BIf he is defeated then the Alliance will surely lose the battle for Alterac.$B$BVanndar is not currently in Alterac Valley.

Captain Galvangar is the trusted aid to Drek'Thar.  He leads the Horde forces from the Iceblood Garrison, in the southern section of the the Field of Strife.$B$BCaptain Galvangar has not yet entered the battle.

Captain Balinda Stonehearth leads the front line Alliance forces.  She is based in the Stonehearth Outpost, in the northern section of the Field of Strife.$B$BBalinda has not yet reentered the battle.

The Stormpikes uncovered ancient artifacts within Alterac Valley, but the Frostwolf orcs don't take kindly to explorers.  If the dwarves have to fight for knowledge of their ancestors, then so be it!$B$BTo win this battle, defeat the orc, Drek'Thar, in Frostwolf Keep.  Fortune be with you, $c!

Alterac Valley has been home to the Frostwolf Clan for years; we will not let the dwarves and their Alliance trespass!  And so we battle!$B$BTo win back Alterac, defeat their general Vanndar Stormpike, in Dun Baldar.$B$BFor the Horde!

Captain Balinda Stonehearth is dead!  Defeat Vanndar and the battle will be ours!

The battle rages, and both our captain and the captain of our enemy are slain!$B$BDrek'Thar now leads us from Frostwolf Keep, and the dwarf Vanndar Stormpike hides deep in Dun Baldar.  Defeat Vanndar and claim victory for the Horde!
The Stormpike general has fallen!  The battle is won!$B$BNow laugh as the Alliance scurries to recover its lost holdings.

Both the Horde and Alliance captains have taken to the field.  Our Captain Galvangar directs the Frostwolves from Iceblood Garrison, and his rival, Captain Balinda Stonehearth, hides in her Stonehearth Outpost.$B$BThe battle has begun!

Both the Horde and Alliance captains have taken to the field.  Our Captain Balinda Stonehearth directs the Stormpike forces from the Stonehearth Outpost, and the enemy Captain Galvangar barks orders from within Iceblood Garrison.$B$BTo battle!

There are two mines in Alterac: the Irondeep in Alliance territory and the Coldtooth mine in Horde territory.  Both mines are a rich source of minerals, and in the past were used to store excess supplies.$B$BNow, these mines are constantly fought over by the Horde, the Alliance and local denizens.

No, $c, that is not all. The elite fighting forces of the opposition are commanded by the four Commanders of the base. Should you be able to strike a fatal and rapid blow to their Commanders, the elite line will falter. Their numbers dwindling to nothing!$B$BBut be warned, soldier; Commanders and Lieutenants are not to be trifled with or taken lightly. They earned those ranks...
Is that all? I thought you were going to challenge me.

Six Lieutenants control the front line's defenses. They must be destroyed first and fast! We cannot risk one of their priests returning the fallen Lieutenants to life.$B$BShould all of the Lieutenants be killed in quick succession, the morale of the front lines will falter! It will be shattered! Their troops will run in fear, leaving the remaining soldiers without backup.
Who do I kill? Just point me in their direction, Commander.

Then listen well, $c.$B$BCan you feel the power radiating from me? Does your morale not swell? Aye, it is the same for the other side. To disrupt their defenses and thin out their troops will be no easy task, but it must be done! Victory will be ours!
Yes I have, Commander.

Beware of entering Frostwolf territory, soldier. The whole damn place is booby trapped! Landmines galore! Speak with our explosives expert in the first tower on the front lines for more information. I am certain that he could teach you how to diffuse the situation.
The Syndicate have been reported to be nosing around in a cave on the eastern plateau. Find out what they're up to, soldier! Beware of Frostwolf activity!

Look alive, soldier! Stormpike Intelligence has reported that a master goblin engineer has been taken prisoner by the Winterax trolls. The Frostwolf dogs are actively trying to rescue him so that they may use his engineered gadgets to destroy us! Do not let that happen.

Watch your step, soldier. The Stormpike have littered the ground around their bases with landmines. Speak with our explosives expert in the watch tower to the east if you want information on how to diffuse their mine fields.
My scouts report that the Syndicate has taken up residence in a hidden cave on the eastern plateau. Be cautious when adventuring in that area.
Greetings, soldier. Intelligence has reported that the Winterax trolls to the west have taken a master goblin engineer prisoner. Perhaps you should investigate?
Such is the price of curiosity.
This place is under my protection. The mysteries of the arcane shall remain inviolate.
You have come to learn of battles won and lost on this field? There are no winners here...

Hail, $c!  Our supply level is high, and we are ready to launch a ground assault through the Field of Strife.  Perhaps if your renown was greater, I would trust you to deliver the assault orders.$B$BSo get out there and fight the Alliance!  Show me you're a trusted and capable member of the Horde!

Once Warmaster Garrick gets his orders, he and his reavers will cut a swath through the Alliance!$B$BDo you want to deliver those orders, $N?  Garrick is waiting in the Field of Strife...

It is good to see you again, Doctor $N. I have been following your progress and I dare say that it is time you learned some of the more advanced bandaging techniques.$B$BReturn to me from time to time, as your skill advances, and I shall teach you all that I know.
Greetings, $N. I am Doctor Gregory Victor, head trauma surgeon of Horde Trauma.
Thank you, good $c.
I will aid you. Give me the instructions.

Though exiled as a heretic, my beliefs still ring true--that alone drives me onward. But for my destiny to be complete, I need the aid of an outsider... one not of any centaur tribe.$B$BThe task requires someone to enter the holy halls of Maraudon--a temple my people protect, and only the most devout are ever allowed to enter.$B$BIf you agree to aid me, then you need only nod. I will pass you a parchment with my instructions on it. Read it over and consider my words.
Please, go on.

Long have my spirit and remains been kept captive here within Maraudon, young $c. The time has given me nothing but ample opportunities to reflect on my mistakes and realize that my jealousy of Remulos was foolish. He attempted to warn and persuade me that my relations with Theradras would bear nothing pure--that only destruction would come from chaos. My brother was right.$B$BBut that does not mean since you have freed me, I am free of penance.
Tell me more about the history of Remulos and Zaetar.

Without knowledge of the incantations required to unite the two parts, Lord Vyletongue was unable to use the scepter. However, now that I am free of the curse of Vyletongue's corruption, I will be able to assist you, if you'd like to bring me the two parts -- both the head and the rod of the scepter.
Why didn't Lord Vyletongue unite both parts of the scepter into one?

As the toxins lurking within Maraudon seeped into my mind, I began to lose my grip on reality. Worried that it would be used for evil, my dryad sisters secretly took the scepter from me, breaking it into two parts and hiding it within the caverns.$B$BSoon they fell victim to the madness as well, and the two parts of the scepter, left unguarded, came to be in the possession of Vyletongue, himself. The satyr entrusted one part to Noxxion, an evil elemental, and the other he still has to this day.
How can I find the two parts of your scepter?
Perhaps we can attempt this later. Please speak to me again if you wish to do so.
Could I have a copy of "The Feast of Winter Veil" to read?
Vile goblins... anything for a gold coin.
I cannot believe those greedy goblins are allowed to hawk their wares while spoiling the spirit of this season.
Spending coin is NOT the reason for the Feast of Winter Veil!
Those goblins should be ashamed of themselves.  Bah!
Please tell me more about Zaetar.
Please tell me more about Maraudon.

I grow weary...$B$BFrom here, you can see the waterfalls, $n...The scepter grants you the power to travel to this very place, should you ever desire to enter through the front gates of Maraudon again.$B$BNear the entrance to Maraudon, you will find a passage that goes down beneath the caverns. Use the scepter at the ancient ritual site to create a portal, and you will find yourself here once more.
No, really, I still don't understand...
Between the orange and the purple passageways near the doors to Maraudon, you will find a third path.$B$BThe scepter you hold in your hands is the key.
I don't quite understand...
Between the colors, a path.$B$BBlink across in light.$B$BFrom the water, you emerge.
Please explain how the scepter works.
Please show me the Stone of Maraudon.

My scepter... After so many years... You have recovered it! You shall truly be the savior of this place...$B$BPlease listen to me carefully, $N. The head and the rod of the scepter may only be reunited into one at the Stone of Maraudon.
I carry both parts of the scepter.
Celebras, I lost my Scepter...
How has this come to be, $N? Do you think that an item such as the Scepter of Celebras is trivial?$B$BI can help you this time, but do not be careless with this valuable item again...
Thank you for what you have done, $N.$B$BKeep the scepter safe; may it aid you in your toil against the evils that have invaded this place...
Free! Free from my bonds at last!
$N, please take a look at the sample of the Vylestem vine that I took from the caverns, so that you know what to look for...
I'll perform these with pleasure, $n!
All right, Reavers!  The orders are here!  To battle!
With pleasure. These things stink!
Just a few more and our stables will be overflowing with mounts. Release it into my custody, soldier. I'll take it from here.
For the King!
Patrol the front line, soldiers!
Ram Riders, REGULATE!
Awaiting orders from my superiors!
YAW! Er, to the front lines with you!
We ride on your command!
The stable is empty! We must provide our cavalry with suitable mounts. Stormpike Stables requests your assistance!
The stables are full again! Our cavalry is soon to ride!
We have gathered enough hides from the wolves. Soon, the cavalry will be ready to ride! Speak to me again when we have stabled enough rams.
Patrol Frost Dagger Pass. Let none through! Die with honor...
Krathok, I was once a weaponsmith and wish to retake the hammer once more! Teach me the way of the weaponsmith.
Krathok, I was once an armorsmith and wish to retake the hammer once more! Teach me the way of the armorsmith.
Myolor, I was once a weaponsmith and wish to retake the hammer once more! Teach me the way of the weaponsmith!
Myolor, I was once an armorsmith and wish to retake the hammer once more! Teach me the way of the armorsmith.

The time has come, brothers. We must not let the enemy advance through Frost Dagger Pass. Some of us will surely perish, but would any of you shy away from this duty? This honor? Onward! For the Horde!
Let me know when it is best to ride. You must be our eyes and ears on the battlefront.
Wolf riders, to Frost Dagger Pass!
Well done, Horde! We have enough Frostwolves in our stables to provide mounts to all of our wolf riders!
We need more wolves! Come to the stables and help!
I wish to stable my pet, Stable Master.
Awaiting orders from my superiors.
You have done an exceptional job, soldier! The cavalry is ready to ride on your command.
Unleash the cavalry!
Death to Stormpike!

$N!  Our supplies are dwindling and until we get more we can't launch large ground assaults into the Field of Strife!$B$BSpeak with the Stormpike Quartermaster.  He'll tell you what you can do to resupply our assault forces.

$N!  What are you doing talking to me?  You should be out fighting the Horde!$B$BI have assault orders for one of our field marshals in the Field of Strife, but I need someone I can count on.$B$BPerhaps if your standing with the Stormpike militia were higher, I could count on you...

Ah, $N!  You're just the person I was hoping to see!  We have enough supplies to send a ground assault against the Horde!  Field Marshal Teravaine is waiting in the Field of Strife for orders...$B$BYou're a brave veteran who's proven himself time and again.  Do you want to deliver Teravaine the orders?
Thank you, Stable Master. Please take the animal.
Well done, soldier. A few more and our stables will be overflowing with mounts for the cavalry to ride into combat!
Greetings, soldier. Are you here to help the cause?
Frostwolf Keep is razed!  We must have supplies in order to repair and rebuild!

Some say that strength and bravery are most needed for an army's success.  And it's true!  But an army also needs supplies to keep itself in good shape, and it's my job to make sure they have what they need.
Dun Baldar took a real beating in the last Horde attack!  We need more supplies in order to rebuild and make repairs!
Tell me about the Glowing Shard.
%s's wings thunder in the distance.
Today, you will meet your ancestors!
You are no match for the strength of the Horde!
If you will not leave Alterac Valley on your own, then the Frostwolves will force you out!
Your attacks are slowed by the cold, I think!
Your spirits are weak, and your blows are weaker!
You cannot defeat the Frostwolf clan!
We, the Alliance, will prevail!
We will not be swayed from our mission!
It'll take more than you rabble to bring me down!
Your attacks are weak!  Go practice on some rabbits and come back when you're stronger.
The Stormpike clan bows to no one, especially the horde!

The Snowfall Graveyard is owned by the Alliance.

The Snowfall Graveyard lies high atop a hill in the Field of Strife, east of Winterax Hold.$B$BThe Alliance currently controls it.

Grant me the wisdom of Winterax!

I am ready to rock, Vipore! Give me a beacon.
The gryphons are ready to strike, $N! You must take this beacon and plant it in the western crater of the central battlegrounds.$B$BDo this and the battle is ours!

Give me the beacon, Slidore! Also, you still stink!
$N! Finally!$B$BYou must take this beacon and plant it in the eastern crater of the central battle grounds. My flight will attack when the beacon beams its coordinates!
My flight is ready! Soldiers come to my aid!
I'm your man, Ich. Give me a beacon!

Pay attention, soldier! You need to take this beacon to the Snowfall graveyard and plant it! Protect it long enough so that my gryphon can lock on.$B$BIf my gryphon gets a solid strike location, Mulv and his crew will be humiliated!
Soldiers of Stormpike, come to my aid! The beacon must be planted.
Double time!
Let me browse your seasonal fare.
Yes, I will deliver the orders to Warmaster Garrick!
It's a cold, bloody battle we wage in Alterac Valley.  It's perfect.
I have orders here for an attack on alliance forces in the middle fields.  I need someone to get them to the assault leader.
You're going down, Mulv!
This is far enough! Meet me back at base!
Just get me close enough to our base and I can channel a teleport!
We've got no time to waste. This is a really long run! Cover me!
Cover me, I'm making a break for it!
I got your back, Slidore, but to be honest, you do stink. Take a shower, man.
I got you covered, Vipore. Move out!
I got your back, Ichman. GO GO GO!
The Forest Lord is aware of the destruction in this valley, $N. Soon we must make our way to the Circle of Calling. Prepare yourself!
The forest shakes and shudders! The winds howl! Does the Forest Lord approach?
Yes. $N. I have located the Forest Lord. We must redouble our efforts! More crystals are needed!
The air is abuzz with energy, Arch Druid. What is the status of the Forest Lord?
I have been lost in the Dream. I sense his lifeforce but my powers have not yet grown strong enough to make contact.
Have you made contact with Ivus, Arch Druid?
Our champion units are equipped!  Beware, alliance!
Our veterans are entering the field!
Seasoned units are taking to the field!
Our champion units are leaving the field.  We need more supplies!
Our veterans are leaving the field.  We need more supplies!
Our seasoned units are leaving the field.  We need more supplies!
It is not for us to judge these atrocities. Ivus will pass judgement once he arrives.
The Arch Druid believes that Ivus the Forest Lord will come once he is made aware of the destructive forces within this valley.
We have been sent here from Darnassus to aid the Stormpike in their time of need.
Champion units are entering the battle!
Veteran units are entering the battle!
Seasoned units are entering the battle!
Our veteran units are leaving the field.  We need more supplies!
Your base is forfeit, puny mortals!
Your base is forfeit, mortals! From its ashes shall rise life!
Ancients, rise!
I come to raze your bases, Frost Wolf clan. Ivus punishes you for your treachery!
Wicked, wicked, mortals! The forest weeps. The elements recoil at the destruction. Ivus must purge you from this world!
We must focus our thoughts upon the Circle of Calling if the Forest Lord is to come! We must hurry! Concentrate your energies!
Onward!
Come, brothers.
Stormpike soldiers, aid and protect us! The Forest Lord has granted us his protection. The gateway must now be opened!
This land is tainted. Ivus must be called!
Upgrade to champion units!
Upgrade to veteran units!
Upgrade to seasoned units!
Let's go, goblin!

I was searching for materials to build my latest and greatest invention, the portable remote control shredder unit, when these trolls clubbed me and dragged me into the depths of their cave.$B$BReturn me to safety and I will lend my aid to your cause, $r.
I am greatly indebted to you, $c. Perhaps I can help your cause.
Lets get back to your base!
The All Seeing Eye must be recovered!
Take it! This thing is probably more trouble than its worth.
I see that you have found the eye.$B$B<Master Ryson grins.>$B$BWell, give it to me!
I don't think you want to learn anything I can teach. Might want to find a $c trainer to help you out.
When you next go to the Molten Core, kill a Firelord for me, will you?
Our lord Hydraxis speaks highly of you.  My water is your water, friend.
Perhaps you will tell me of your deeds, $N.  I would be honored to know them.
You have made our enemies your own.  I will gladly share waters with you.
Tales of your exploits spread.  Your name is not unknown to us, $N.
Greetings, little one.  You have business with the Waterlords?
Speak not your vulgar language to me!  Only Hydraxis can stand it.
You have no business with me, little one.
Speak with Hydraxis.
I need a Scrying Scope to view the Globe of Scrying, Ryson.

$N, you are ready for the ultimate task.  The fiery runes etched on the floor of the molten core are conduits to the realm of fire, and their presence is both an affront to us and a source of power for the Firelords.  They must be extinguished!$B$BTo extinguish a rune, take a vial of aqual quintessence.  Pour it on the rune and its flame will go out, rendering it useless and weakening our enemy!
Absolutely. Give me a beacon, Ryson.

Take this beacon and advance upon the enemy's base. Make your way to the outside of their main stronghold and place the beacon in the center of the courtyard. Defend the beacon from attackers until the Eye has locked on the beacon's coordinates.$B$BOnce this is done, all activity outside the enemy's base will be viewable from here.$B$BWill you take on this task?
What is this task?
You have only just begun to see the Eye's power, $c. If you wish to facilitate the abilities of the Eye, then there is a task that you must complete.
The power of the Eye is unquestionable, Ryson, but what else can it do?
Take it! Return to me should the Eye's power falter.
I wish to see my enemies, Ryson. Show them to me.
Thank you, $N.  I'll mobilize my people right now!
The orders are given!  Move out, and show them what we're made of!
The Eye sees all within its sphere of influence, $c. What is it that you wish to see?
Give me the orders!  I will deliver them to Teravaine in the Field of Strife!

$N, what are you waiting for?  Find Field Marshal Teravaine in the Field of Strife and give him the assault orders.  Once he gets the orders, he and his troops will charge into the Horde and take no prisoners!
Sending ground assaults takes huge amounts of supplies!
Surrender an' we'll let ye live, heathens! Jus' put down yer arms an' march!
FER THE KING! Push 'em back, soldiers!
Show our enemies your resolve, soldiers! Crush them underfoot! Under steel!
Rally around your Lieutenants and Commanders, soldiers! Keep the savages at bay!
Withdraw your troops, brother, and I promise you a swift second death!
Show these savages no mercy, soldiers! They'll give none to you!
I wish to learn my leatherworking focus.

The Earth Mother watch over us; under cover of the night as in the day. Let this fire illuminate both our bodies and spirits and remind us of our honored ancestors, who are ever present and guiding our way.
Jeztor's Riders are ready! Soldiers of the Horde, report for duty!
War Riders are now ready! Soldiers of the Horde, I need your assistance.
Yeee hawww! Mulverick's fleet is ready to rock. All able bodied Horde soldiers need request a beacon and try their damndest to plant it so that my War Riders can home in for the aerial assault.
I'm ready to plant the beacon, Mulv. Give me a beacon.
The time has come to prove your worth as a wing man, $N. Take this beacon and plant it dead center of the Snowfall graveyard. Defend it until my fleet arrives.$B$B<Mulverick salutes.>
Consider it done, Jeztor. Give me a beacon.
The fleet is ready, $N. You must take this beacon and place it at the western crater of the central battlezone. Defend the beacon from attackers until the fleet is able to lock on to its coordinates!
I'll get that beacon to the crater safely, Guse. You can count on me!
I require a vial of aqual quintessence, Hydraxis, for I go to the Molten Core to extinguish a rune of the Firelords.
$N, it is good to see you.  Our war with the other elemental lords yet rages, but your efforts help ensure our victory.
I am Hydraxis, Duke of the Waterlords.  You are not an elemental and so cannot understand our struggle, but perhaps we can strike a deal that will benefit us both...
** SERVOS DESTROYED. UNIT TARGETTING CORRUPT. SHUT DOWN IMMINENT. **
** PLANTED. CONFIRMING WAR RIDER LOCK. STAND BY. T-MINUS 60 SECONDS. **
** CONFIRMS TARGET LOCK. WAR RIDER UNIT INCOMING.  AERIAL ASSAULT IMMINENT. **
The fleet is ready, $N. You must take this beacon and place it at the eastern crater of the central battlezone. Defend the beacon from attackers until the fleet is able to lock on to its coordinates!

You continue to thumb through the journal looking for any information that might help in your search for the stolen chest.$B$BTowards the final pages of the book, in red pencil, you see a notation from James along the side of the page. It says, "Old home near Stone Cairn Lake... gnolls will work perfectly as bodyguards."$B$BThere is no reason to suggest this is where the chest is, but there doesn't seem to be any other clues.
Soon, Lokholar shall rise... Soon... Very, very soon...
The Shaman Commander is not to be trifled with, $r.
We are under direct orders from Cairne, $r. Do not interfere with the Commander's task.
Never look the Commander directly in the eyes.
The pages of the journal seem to be filled with information about trades, buyers  and other miscellaneous business related events.
Holds mistletoe over $g his : her; head
Kazzak is supreme!
For the Legion! For Kil'Jaeden!
Leave this sacred place or perish!
I will be your wingman!
I need a few good wing men to get me out of here safely and back to base.
I have made contact, $N. It is Lokholar the Ice Lord. He has deemed our cause worthy - our earth bound sacrifice sufficient. He comes soon... prepare yourself.
I sense a great power among us, Commander. Is the spell ready?
Yes, $N. The elements are stirring. Soon, we will unleash their might upon our enemies. They shall reel from the blows!
We must be close, Commander. I can feel the elements stirring.
There is much work left to be done, $N! Continue to strike down our enemies!
How much more blood is needed, Commander?
Nothing must befoul the gardens! You must be destroyed!
You can count on me, Jeztor.
About damn time someone came. What took you so long? Ah, nevermind. Cover me, soldier. I gotta make it back to base!
I got your back, Guse.
Good work, soldier. I need to get back to base camp! Will you cover me?
I need a ride out of here, Martin.

It's just so horrible. Our three top guns were shot down over Alliance territory during an air assault Nobody knows if they're dead or alive!$B$BThis is a terrible blow to our air strike capabilities.
Channel your energies into the Altar!
Do not summon me again unless you have a real question to ask, ok?
Is that some kind of a joke?
It is not worth answering.
Forget about it!
It is done! The Ice Lord has arrived! Bow to the might of the Horde, fools!
Watch as the blood seeps into the snow, children. The elemental will be bound to us!
Answer cannot be seen through the twisting nether.
The Ice Lord will consume the entire Stormpike army!
The blood of our enemies shall be spilt upon the battlefield. The great elementals shall answer our call and crush all that stand in our way.
%s's death wail has stirred the nearby silithid hive!
I drink in your suffering, mortal. Let your essence congeal with Lokholar!
The blood of a thousand Alliance soldiers I shall spill... None shall stand against the might of the Ice Lord!
WHO DARES SUMMON LOKHOLAR?
This expedition is a terrible drain on military supplies.
I've reached my supply needs for now.
Soldiers of Frostwolf, come to my aid! The time has come to unleash the fury of the elements upon them!
Good work, soldier. Now we light the fires and spite their ire!
I come for you, puny Alliance!
I need to get back to my ride. Search and destroy imminent! Cover me! On my six! GO GO GO!
Guse? Jeztor? Are they... flat spin?? Seas of Southshore??
Let's get down to business!
There's no time to waste, trooper. I must get back to base immediately! Cover me!
WOOT! Made it!
Cover me, soldier! I have to make it back to our base and get the fleet prepped for an aerial assault!
Hook me up!
In Alterac Valley, battles rage and equipment is in short supply.
The kobolds are retaking the Coldtooth Mine!

It is here we remember every sacrifice our citizens have made during the first war that riddled our people.

Rally around your Lieutenants and Commanders! Protect our bases!
Push them back to their base! Let not a single Alliance soldier remain living on this battlefield!
RUN THEM THROUGH, SOLDIERS!
Crush them!!!
We have done it, $N!
Look, just at the water's surface!
$N, I sense that the great beast draws near...
Please return to Zoram'gar and report our success to the Warsong Runner.
I am going to patrol the area for a while longer and ensure that things are truly safe.
A book by a goblin on gnomish military victories... and all the pages are blank.  Figures.
I should talk to Dewey about some sort of notation system to these keep books better organized.
So many bookshelves, so little time...
Quite the riveting tale.  Now I know why there was so much dust on that book.
Now where did I put that companion document?
You have my deepest gratitude, $N. I thank you.
Bah, it's not here.  I wonder where I left it last...
This is the brazier, $N. Put it out. Vorsha is a beast, worthy of praise from no one!
Show strength to your enemy, and we will prevail!
I require aid.
Take heart!  Pain goes away and $gladies love men with scars:men love women with scars;!
Messengers from Ravenholdt delivered this letter to me this morning. It is addressed to you, $N.
$N, this came for you this morning.
May I have it, please.
I got something for you, $N. Looks important.
Help! Guards! It's going to step on me!
Stable Master
Why did you kill me, $N?
The stable master
I'm a test spirit healer.
If I was not bound by duty to Master Ravenholdt, I would follow you to the ends of the world, $G Master:Mistress; $N. You are grace and cunning personified.
I wept like a babe when I heard of your heroics. Master Ravenholdt would do well to have an apprentice like you.
And to think, one day you might be the one that the stories of legend are about!
Your time has come, $N. Master Kang awaits...
I really envy you, $N. You do amazing work.
Marvelous. Simply marvelous. You are an inspiration to us all, $N.
You should talk to Winstone. I hear he's looking for thieves with your skill.
You're shaping up nicely, $N. I've heard good things...
Making it out of here without a blade in your back or poison in your veins would be an accomplishment.
You dare set foot inside Ravenholdt Manor, worm?
The Manor has been abuzz with talk of your arrival, $G Master:Mistress; $N. We are all honored and graced by your presence.
It is my dream to one day serve under your command, $G Master:Mistress; $N. That is, should you ever deem me worthy of such things...
I am unworthy of this conversation, $G Master:Mistress;.
Tales of your heroics are heard throughout Ravenholdt Manor, $G Master:Mistress; $N.
Your presence steels our nerves, $G Master:Mistress; $N.
$G Master:Mistress; $N! Master Kang has been asking about you! Perhaps it is your time!
I believe Simone was looking for you earlier, $N. Have you spoken with her yet?
An honor to see you again, $N.
You have truly grown more cunning, $N.
The Syndicate is made up of a bunch of hacks - disorganized, unskilled, and lazy...
Greetings, $c. Have you spoken with Fahrad yet?
It is good to see you again, $N.
Brash. Master Ravenholdt does not like brash.
Ravenholdt Manor does not recognize you, $c.
Watch your back, stranger.
You look like you could use some work, $g fella:lady;. You should board the tram and visit my brother, Monty, at the Ironforge Deeprun Tram depot. I'm sure he has something you could do.
I wish to make a purchase, Nipsy.
Now you are ready to learn the finer points of kodo hide tanning. Let us begin...
First you must prove yourself to me, then I will train you.
I am sorry but I can not train any more apprentices. Seek out Mak in Thunder Bluff. He will be able to teach you the basics.
Your skills have surpassed mine, young one. Go see Una who has a shop in Thunder Bluff's central plateau. She can give you the guidance you seek.
Winner! We be havin' a winner here!
I'm ready to find the squirrel, Monty.
The little feller be hidin' in one o' them boxes, matey. G'luck!
Your own strength feeds me, $n!
Don't crowd me, people!
Do yer part in keepin' the Deeprun Tram clean!
Overflowin' with rats! Help a pirate out, matey!
I do not believe you possess the mental acuity to grasp the nature of portal magic.
As a mage, you are one of a select group that can conjure a portal to transport you back to this very place.  I can teach you if you are ready.
Please teach me.
Half way there...
You need to be exalted with the trolls of the Darkspear tribe before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
You need to be exalted with the tauren of Thunder Bluff before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
You need to be exalted with the orcs of Orgrimmar before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
You need to be exalted with the humans of Stormwind before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
You need to be exalted with the Forsaken of the Undercity before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
You need to be exalted with the dwarves of Ironforge before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
You looking for plucky?  Well, you didn't hear me say this, but... maybe if you ask Kronkrider up in the tower, he'll tell you...
Plucky?  I heard race master Kronkrider up on the the tower knows where he is.
Stay calm, people.  We don't want to give away our position.
We'll be notching our axes after this.
They say Duriel is a fierce night elf.  It'll be a good fight!
These woods make my tusks itch...
With luck, we'll gain some good scars today.
Steady, people.  We'll raid soon enough.
Intruders! Attack the intruders!
Stay back! Children should not be here! Be gone, child!

You are not known to my people.  A kodo is a mighty steed, and it is the product of love and care by my people; such is not given onto strangers.  Until the elders of Thunder Bluff consider you to be exalted, I cannot offer you the sale of a kodo.

I'm sorry $g mon : sis;, but I won't be sellin' my raptors to someone who hasn't proven themselves to be exalted to the Darkspear tribe.  When ya make a stand and show yourself to be no less than exalted to us, then I'll make my raptors available to ya.
Perhaps we will get a moment to rest. But I will not give up until we have faced off against Vorsha!
Be on your guard, $N!
Now we must wait, $N. It won't be long before the naga realize what we have done.
Fear lies in your heart, $N. When you truly are ready to face Vorsha the Lasher, come speak with me.
Train me in the ways of the beast.
You've come for training in order to pass it on to your pets?
Show me your selection of grimoires.
You're no warlock and I've no time for you.  Begone!
Want to make your demons more powerful?  It'll cost you, but you've come to the right place.
Show me what I have access to, Lokhtos.

The Thorium Brotherhood possesses the knowledge required to make the sacred arms and armaments of the Fire Lord, but we lack the manpower to obtain the materials required for the crafting.$B$BI, Lokhtos Darkbargainer, have been empowered by the Brotherhood to exchange the exalted recipes for materials gathered from the Molten Core.$B$BPresent your offer, $r.
Yeah, you know a few things! If you wanna' learn more you're gonna' have to talk to Georgio Bolero in Stormwind.
Warriors of the night... Assemble!
For the Great Mother!
In position!
Now, answer me this, $N:$BWhich creature became the Lich King before spreading the plague across Lordaeron?
It's always nice when someone wishes to speak to me. How are things with you, $c?
Greetings, $c. Is there something I can help you with?
Malygos, is it?
Alexstrazsa, the Life-Binder. A magnificent creature.
Neltharion, hmm? As good an answer as any, yes?
Malygos is my answer.
Alexstrasza is  my answer.
Neltharion is  my answer.
Ah, Ysera the Dreamer.
Ysera is my answer.
Ner'zhul is my answer.
Kil'jaeden is my answer.
Gul'dan is my answer.
Kel'Thuzad is my answer.
Ah, Ner'zhul. Not a name that should be uttered lightly, but I did ask you for an answer.$B$BAnd Ner'zhul is the correct one.
An interesting response to my question... and the wrong one.
Gul'dan. Not a name many have heard on Azeroth.$B$BUnfortunately, not the correct answer.
Kel'Thuzad? If you know that name at all, then perhaps you did read the book I sent you to get.$B$BUnfortunately, you're answer is incorrect.
While nothing can change the past, time can heal all wounds. Thank you for showing me that it is possible, $N. I wish you well.
Why have you come here, $c?
I require training, Nissa.
Are you a student of the medical sciences?
