I regret to inform you that you have failed your examination, doctor.
The good doctor saves the day! HOORAY!
Brain encaved... mortar... bas... hed... leaking... dyin... g...
Goodbye, cruel world... I'm leavin' you today... goodbye... goodbye... goodbye...
I'm not gonna make it... death comes...
My entrails are leaking out! HELP!
I... I think I see Blue...
Dying... See the light... gloriouss...
Heeellp meee... ri... ribss... bro... broken.
I require training, Daryl.
I keep 'em fed, kid. Yep, Daryl Riknussun, at yer service.
I require training, Zamja.
Can Zamja help you, $r?
I wish to browse your goods, Dirge.
Where can I find Crystal Restore?
Where can I get Enchanted Thorium?
Please, leave this place, $N. You know nothing of what troubles us...
I require training, Grimnur.
Yap, I can teach ye to fish.
I require training, Lumak.
Fish so delicious. You come learn fish? Eat fish? Mmmmm...

Stonetalon Mountain has many perilous caves through out this region.  Exploring these caves can hold many adventures for those willing to risk life for glory.$B$B$C, perhaps you seek riches that only following your heart and soul can garnish.
So you're here for the Warsong axes. Well, it's about time, $N. That crate has been sitting out there for days, now.$B$BFeel free to haul it away whenever you are ready.
Myranda, do you have enough eyeballs to make another amulet? I have lost the old one.
Of course, Warchief!
I live only to serve, Warchief! My life is empty and meaningless without your guidance.
I... I did not think of it that way, Warchief.
With all due respect, Warchief - why not allow them to be destroyed? Does this not strengthen our position?
Usurper?
What discoveries?
Please share your wisdom with me, Warchief.
Pathetic. You two do not deserve the training you are getting here if that was the best you can do.
I submit myself for further training my master.
I seek further druidic training to have a closer understanding of the Earth Mother's will.
It is a greater knowledge of the ways of the warlock that I crave.
You know enough to be dangerous, but you still look like you need training to me $N.
How fortuitous. Usually, I must leave my lair in order to feed.
Who dares attack the Silverwing Outpost?!?
Ok, let's move out!
Ragers, Fetch!
I got nothin' more to teach! Not for somebody who knows as much as you do, anyway! You Horde types need to talk to Nogg in Orgrimmar!
I wish to unlearn my talents.
Yes. I do.

Welcome, my $g brother : sister;.  If you are here to train, then I would be delighted to train you.$B$BThere will be a time soon where the call of the Emerald Dream will take hold in you.  You will hibernate for many years and walk amongst the purest of forms.  It is there and then that your ultimate training will take place.
%s's medallion shatters.
Look at the wisdom and knowledge of the beast, and you will see yourself. Observe as the owl does, learn cleverness from the sabercat, embody the mighty spirit of the wolf.
I am ready, as are my forces. Let us end this masquerade!

The dragon hides behind a royal facade. The tablets will reveal her for what she is... If what I have seen holds true, I will not survive this battle, friend. It is you that must finish what I have started. Are your forces ready? Are you ready? We will begin on your command.

Was this fated, Windsor? If it was death that you came for, then the prophecy has been fulfilled. May your consciousness rot in the Twisting Nether. Finish the rest of these meddlesome insects, children. Bolvar, you have been a pleasurable puppet.
The Drag race will start in 1 minute!
Get your seats, folks!  The race is starting in 2 minutes!
What can you tell me about the hippogryph - Sharptalon?
What can you tell me about the nightsaber cat - Shadumbra?
What can you tell me about the bear - Ursangous?
Place Termite Barrel on the crate.
I would like to train.
Who sent you here? You're not ready for my instruction yet! You'll be told when you're ready.
You're doing very well in the art of tailoring, I must admit. Now, let's see how good you REALLY are...
Well done. You have now earned tailoring's highest honor. Go forth, and do terrible things with this knowledge!
The place is a bit drafty... but what do I care? I'm dead.
I am not worthy, sir.
I cannot help you until you have learned more of the essentials. Come back to me when you are ready.
You have come a long way, traveler. There is one more task for you to perform...
You have truly become one of the finest tailors in the business! Congratulations, I am proud to have been your instructor!
I have outfitted kings. With the proper training, you can too.
Good! I can tell that my efforts will not be wasted!
I will instruct you when the time is right... that time is not now. You have much more to learn first!
Before your learning may begin, I must ask of you a favor...
You require the instruction of a true master! Go to Daryl Stack in Tarren Mill and embrace your destiny!
Cloth is okay. Personally I prefer to work with human skin.
You'll need more training before I can share my knowledge with you, I'm afraid.
I require all my students to prove their dedication. Now it's your turn...
There's only one person I know of who is more learned in the art of tailoring than myself. Last I heard he could be found in Theramore Isle. He is the person you should seek.
Yes, I've been running this shop for some time now. Business has been pretty good lately. A lot of new adventurers coming through...
How can I share my secrets with a beginner? Try speaking with Victor Ward first.
Okay... so you wanna' be a tailor. How about you prove it?
You have worked your way up... time to see the boss. Go to Josef and tell him you are ready.
Tailoring can come in very handy. I once had to sew my arm back on.
You are truly a determined student. I will be happy to provide you with instruction!
There are fundamental things you must learn before I can aid you. Speak to my apprentice, Vhan. He is kind and patient and will teach you what you need to know.
There walks a hero.
I will require a demonstration of your determination before I share my gifts with you...
My knowledge is limited, though I am still learning. It is time for you to move on, traveler. Find Josef Gregorian in Undercity and tell him you are ready.
Aren't the patterns beautiful? Each one speaks with its own voice.
Expertly accomplished! Now, let us continue your education...
You still have lessons to learn before I may begin your training. In the meantime, perhaps Vhan, in Thunder Bluff can help you.
There is a task I would like you to perform before we go any further...
Your knowledge is great, traveler. You must learn from one who is wiser than I. Many tales have been told of the wisdom of Josef Gregorian. You may find him in Undercity.
Welcome to our tent. May I assist you?
You have done well, traveler. I am proud to call you my student!
There are basics that must be learned. Trianna is standing nearby, speak with her and return to me later.
There are many obstacles one must overcome on the path to excellence. Your path is no exception...
Your talents excel! You are truly inspired. To continue your pursuit of knowledge, speak with Georgio Bolero in Stormwind. He is held in high regard, and will be able to further your instruction.
What a fine day! It inspires me to create a new design.
Well well, not too bad. Maybe I CAN show you a few things...
Ha! You ain't got what it takes... yet! Come back to me after you've learned a few things!
Maybe you got it, maybe you don't. I think I got a way to find out...
Not bad... for an amateur! Still, you know about as much as I do. If you wanna' learn more you're gonna' have to talk to Josef Gregorian in Undercity.
They say a stitch in time saves... what, eleven? Ah, I can't remember. Stupid saying anyway.
What? Why are you bothering me? Why, I bet you can't even create a high quality robe! Go talk to Snang and come back when you're worthy of my talents!
You think you just walk up to me and I start teaching you? Ha! You need to pay your dues like everyone else!
You need to learn from someone who knows more than I do. Go talk to Josef Gregorian in Undercity. Well, what are you still doing here?
I made a lot of the things you see in the store. What do you think? Answer carefully, your life may depend on it.
I don't have time to babysit! Go talk to me assistant, Uthrar!
I don't train just anyone! You'll need to perform a task first!

Well, aren't you the smarty-pants? Ye know more than I do, I can tell ye that! Don't go getting' a big head, but if ye want to keep learnin', have a chat with Georgio Bolero in Stormwind. They say he knows his tailorin'!
Ah, this Darnassian fabric is the finest!
A fine display of worthiness. Your instruction may now continue.
Speak with Lawrence Shneider at Duncan's Textiles around the corner to the left. He is adept at dealing with beginners.
I will teach you, but first you must prove your worth...
You are beyond my level of expertise. Georgio Bolero, the master of Duncan's Textiles around the corner could help you advance your skills.
Good day to you.

Your understanding of leather is deeper than my own. Perhaps you should visit Aayndia Floralwind in the town of Astranaar in Ashenvale Forest. She has much knowledge to offer a student of your talents.
What is this? You trying to ruin my reputation? I don't teach novices, $gbuddy:lady;. Go talk to Milla Fairancora in the Craftsmen's Terrace of Darnassus.
Thanks for your help, $N. Because of you, another shipment arrived safely at the excavation.
Are you here to help with the delivery? Miran's just about ready.
This dock here?  Well you can catch the ship that goes to that Night Elf place.  What's it's name?  Uhh Auberdine I think.  I don't really know for sure, I just load and unload stuff.
Sure! Let's go for a ride.
I'm sorry but I can not let you ride my gryphons. You should go talk to Gringer if you need a ride somewhere.
Let me browse your goods.

I am afraid that I am no longer gentle or humble. Age and countless battles have hardened my skin and soul. Perhaps that is why Cairne assigned me to Sun Rock Retreat... the gentle winds and warm sun does ease the pain.
Dat's da attitude! Grab a needle and thread and let's get jammin'!
At dis point you know as much as I do, mon. Maybe you go see Magar in Orgrimmar. He not be da happiest tailor around, but he help you anyway.
Hey mon, what can I be doin' for you?
You will not be disappointed, traveler. Tailoring is a joyous endeavor.
My education is ongoing, and your knowledge surpasses mine. If you wish to learn more you must speak to Me'lynn. She will guide you.
There is no greater way to clear the mind than to weave.
I'm just a student myself, really. Rhiannon's the expert. She's standing by the crates over there. You can learn a lot from her.
We don't get many visitors out here. May I interest you in something?
I am knowledgable, but I am not an expert. You know who you should talk to? Rhiannon! She's not far. Ask around for her in Undercity
Pleased to make you acquaintance. May I help you?
With the Earth Mother's blessing, we shall begin.
You seek a higher knowledge. Tepa is blessed with such knowledge. She should be standing somewhere nearby...
No part of the animals we hunt is wasted.
I will teach you what I can.
I know a few things, but I'm no expert. Lucky for you, Magar is. He's standing near the back of the shop. See if he can help you, but be careful not to rile him. He can be irritable.
We use many animal pelts and skins in our creations.
Hold on there, I'm just an assistant. If ye want to start learnin' the fancy stuff, talk to old Stonebrew over there.
Welcome to me shop. What can I do for ye'?
I would be happy to take you under my wing. Let us begin.
It is time for you to journey to Darnassus and speak to Me'lynn. She will guide you from now on.
Needlework requires a steady hand. And patience... above all, patience.
Very well, let your journey of tailoring begin.
Hmm... the things you need to learn are a little above my head. Have a talk with Sellandus over at Larson's Clothiers just up the path to the right. He taught me everything I know!
Life is like a carefully woven tapestry.
So you would like to learn a few things? I would be happy to get you started!

I'm a simple man who knows a few things about tailoring, but you need more assistance than I can provide. I have heard of a Night Elf who is quite an accomplished tailor. He resides in Stormwind, in the Magic District.
I can tell that your wardrobe is in dire need of care.

We cannot afford to give an inch in this war. Day and night, I create new armor, and I patch whatever can be salvaged from the old. I have no time for other tasks. Would you take care of something for me?
I only wish I had more students like you. Not many will venture so far into enemy territory. I salute your courage.
All requests for my work must be made in person by the buyer. Orwin often asks me to reconsider, but my priorities lie here. Look around you: many of these fighters rely upon me for their armor.

I'm not here to teach babes fresh out of the cradle. Ye've nowhere near the amount of skill I require in my students. In fact, ye're a sad figure of a $glad:lass;, an' I'll thank ye not to stand there jibber-jabberin' at me.
I love a good challenge; don't you? Aye, of course ye do. An' that's why you're about to do exactly what I say.

Och, 'twas a sad day when I realized my obsession. I woke up and found myself tannin' before I had my first tankard of ale. Hardly even a respectable hangover! I knew then--aye, I knew!--how it was goin' to be.
I can make amazing things with the materials I find out here. By Muradin's beard, there are fantastic creatures in these hills! Go have a whack at them, $N, and bring me back some tall tales.
It's been so long since I was a novice myself that I don't think I'd be the best teacher for you. Try talking to Tarn or Mak, right over there. One of them should be able to answer your questions.
As members of the Horde, we must contribute to our community to ensure that it continues to thrive. Thus, I am certain you will gladly aid us by undertaking a small task I have for you.
Even my talents have a limit, and you have reached it. Congratulations, $N. Your next stop should be Camp Mojache in Feralas. The tauren Hahrana Ironhide lives there; she is renowned for her skill.
The needle is small, but the thread is strong, and the stitches are fine. Our pact with Thrall and the others will hold. The Horde will not be driven from these lands.
I regret to say that I cannot aid you, $gnoble sir:gentle lady;, until you learn more of working with leather. Speak with Faldron or Darianna here instead. They can teach you the skill you require.
You have demonstrated skill in learning our craft. Do you also possess the resolve to complete a mission on my behalf?
You have advanced beyond my skill to teach you. Journey now to Aerie Peak in the Hinterlands and speak with the dwarf Drakk Stonehand. His work is magnificent, far better than my own.
The grass is soft and lush. The air is fresh, full of light and song. Everything I've seen suggests that Teldrassil is a dream come true. Why, then, is my heart full of foreboding?

In the northeastern Barrens lies a pool of water sickened by pollution.  The locals call it the Sludge Fen; the Venture Company has turned the once crystal-blue waters into a mire of industrial byproducts and waste.  In the heart of this fen lies what you seek, $N.$B$BBe warned - the Venture Company does not tolerate trespassers, and they consider anyone who does not work for them as such.  You'll especially be a target as a protector of nature, something they vehemently oppose.

In the Silverpine Forest along the edges of the North Tide's Run, a derelict boat rests on the shore.  Out to the west of this lies what you seek; swim too far and the ocean will crush you from fatigue.  It resides on the ocean floor in a lockbox, waiting for you to claim it.$B$BYou'll be hard pressed to survive a dive to such depths without aid, so take heart; a bubbly fissure offers renewed breath to divers seeking this half of the pendant.  Use it wisely.

The waters of Westfall are where you must search, due west-northwest of where the Gold Coast Quarry meets with the shore.  An anchor shows where a boat has sunk beyond it, deep within the water.  The underwater pressure is fierce here; swimming too far will crush even the mightiest swimmer from fatigue.  $B$BLook for a natural formation to aid you, $N - a bubbly fissure is near here, offering deep-water swimmers a chance for renewed breath.
Do you know where I may find the Half Pendant of Aquatic Endurance?
Do you know where I may find the Half Pendant of Aquatic Agility?
I need a ride, Dungar!  I have important supplies to deliver!
I only teach students who have already mastered the basics. You must seek out the night elf Darianna in the Craftsmen's Terrace of Darnassus. Her skills will be a perfect complement to yours.
I cannot leave my post here, $N, but there is a task that must be taken care of. Can I trust you to see it done?
Training you further is beyond my abilities. Speak to Telonis in the Craftsmen's Terrace of Darnassus. He is always glad to help talented students.
Elune has granted the night elves many gifts. In return, it is our responsibility to safeguard these forests from the demonic taint that the Horde always brings with it.
If I taught novices, there'd be a lot more students visiting me, and things would get noisy. Go talk to Dan Golthas over there. He's a little intense, but he means well, and he's a decent teacher.
Yes, yes, I'll train you. There's no need to raise your voice.
I'm pleased to say that your talents have outpaced my own. Go away now. Err, try the tauren Una in the northwestern shops of Thunder Bluff's central plateau. She's very skilled, I assure you.

Before my death, I was a librarian; I had nothing to do with wars and plagues. I never asked to become this. On the other hand, now that my mind is my own again, I'm not about to surrender without a fight.
You can't study my techniques until you've learned the basics. Speak with Kamari if you are interested in training.
That's decent work, I admit. But I'd be more impressed if you'd handle something for me.

You won't learn anything new from me; you know too much already. If you want more training, talk to the tauren Una in the northwestern shops of Thunder Bluff's central plateau. Send her my regards, eh?
Am I busy? What's that supposed to mean? Do you think I just stand here all day, twiddling my thumbs? If you're here to buy something, talk to Handor.
We're pretty far from anything I'd call civilization here, at least until the Horde can send us more reinforcements. You must really like working with leather.
There's enough work here for an army of orcs, and most of it, only I can do. Still, there is a job I could use a hand with.
I'd train you if I could, but you're too much for me. Tell you what: go talk to the tauren Una in the northwestern shops of Thunder Bluff's central plateau. She's got some real talent.
We have only a small foothold on this continent for now, but the humans can't fight us off forever. Then they'll pay for enslaving us. We'll cut their lying tongues out for their treachery.
Your skills are insufficient to learn what I teach. Try talking to Mak over there instead. He can help you out until you're ready for more advanced lessons.
You have come to me for instruction, and in return I have a favor to ask of you. See it done, and you will be rewarded.
I cannot help you with further training: your skill at working with leather rivals my own. You should speak with Una, over there. I will vouch for your skill if need be.
My axe has seen many battles, and I like to keep it handy. Enemy forces have fought their way into our capital several times now, but have no fear: we have always driven them back.
I do not offer apprentice training. Look for the tauren Waldor in the Wailing Caverns, here in the Barrens. He can assist you with whatever you need.
A task presses upon me, but I do not have the time to take care of it myself. Can I entrust you with it?
I cannot aid you with further lessons: your skills have surpassed mine. Go and see the tauren Una in the northwestern shops of Thunder Bluff's central plateau. She offers more advanced training.
This blue leather does draw the eye, I know. You see, we have a great many eager recruits running around here, hunting and slaying with more enthusiasm than wisdom. One must take precautions.

Well, I declare! It's a new student! I'll gladly teach you everything I know once you have a little more skill. Go talk to Gretta Finespindle over there, would you? She'll have you up to speed in no time.
I can see that you'll be a quick learner. That's good for me, because I'm always busy these days. In fact, that reminds me: could you run a quick errand for me?
Nope, can't help you, I'm afraid. Your skills have mine beat! If you want to learn more, talk to the night elf Telonis in the Craftsmen's Terrace of Darnassus. He's amazing!
Lots to do! Haven't been this busy since my cousin accidentally vaporized all the cloth and leather in Gnomeregan. My, it was drafty for a while! Ah, $N, those were the days....
In time you will be ready for what I have to teach, $N. Until then, please ask Darianna over there to help you with your training.
This war has been an enormous drain upon our people and resources. Even here on Teldrassil, we cannot escape its repercussions. Forgive me for asking it of you, but would you perform a task for me?
If you are here for further training, you have overestimated my abilities. Have a word with Telonis over there; he can help you.

Darianna shows promise, but she is so full of energy that it is hard for her to stay still and listen. With her strength and agility, I fear it won't be long before she is called to fight. We must teach her quickly.
Come back to me when you've had more training. Randal Worth over there can help you with that.
Okay, I'll teach you, but I want you to do something for me. This is important, so pay close attention.
Sorry, but you've reached the limit of what I can teach. If you want to learn more, go see Telonis in the Craftsmen's Terrace of Darnassus. He's pretty talented, so I hear.
Randal's a bit of a dandy, but he's dependable, which is more than I can say for a lot of the students I take on. Still, I guess I can't blame them for wanting a bit of adventure.
Even I have my limitations! Go talk to Lavinia Crowe in Undercity if you wish to further your training.
My teachings would be too advanced for you at this stage. If you wish to learn more of potions, speak with Tel'Athir here instead.
You were wise to seek me out. I would ask a small favor. In return, there is much I can teach you.
You are beyond my limited abilities. Seek out the night elf Ainethil in the Craftsmen's Terrace of Darnassus. She can teach you more. I only wish that I could go with you.
I'm free!  That device shall never torment me again!
Take every word I say and commit it to memory. Until our enemies have been eradicated, we must never shirk a chance to further our knowledge. Reinforce your armor, and never relax your guard.
I can't help you; your work is beyond my own. Talk to Arthur Moore, over there by the coffins. He'll be able to train you further.
Your talent is beyond my own, friend. Speak with Tarn here; his knowledge of leather is much greater than mine. I'm sure he would welcome another student.
Cairne himself lives here, they say. Once I have finished crafting a fitting gift, I will seek him out. Perhaps he will have words of wisdom for me.
Even here in the wilds, you seek out learning. Your drive for knowledge is an admirable trait.
The caverns below us are a source of strange and wondrous hides, but you must take care if you venture into their depths, $N. Remember that your own skin is far more valuable.

You have outgrown any teachings I could offer. Go with the blessing of the Earth Mother. Seek out the tauren Tarn in the northwestern shops of Thunder Bluff's central plateau. Be guided by his wisdom.

Meat, skin, bones... a good hunter lets nothing go to waste. Every scrap of leather can be salvaged, perhaps to reinforce an ally's armor. Thus, each of us is strong alone, but together we become invincible.
You've got the hang of it. I can't teach you any more, but talk to Arthur Moore, a Forsaken who works in the Rogues' Quarter of the Undercity. Tell him I sent you.

Skin, glorious skin. It holds your insides... in. You might've noticed my skin's not doing so well. To think I used to worry about my pores. Hardly any skin left to worry about these days. In a way, it's very freeing.
I have nothing more to teach you. Talk to Karolek if you wish to further your leatherworking skills.
You like the rug? I killed and skinned the beast myself. May all the centaur fall as easily.
Oh, goody, something else to do while I wait! You're a real life-saver, $N!
Aww, what rotten luck! My skills aren't good enough to be of any use to you. Oh well. Talk to Fimble Finespindle over there by the loom. He's been working with leather for longer than I have.
This hide isn't ready to work with yet. I wish it didn't take so long to make leather. There has to be some way to cut down on all this waiting. It can't be good for my health, you know?
Oh, I'm sorry, but you know more about leather than I do at this point. Talk to Faldron over there if you wish to learn more.
If you're interested in sewing with leather, you've certainly come to the right place. Faldron and Telonis are true artists, and I hope to learn much from them.
My apologies, but you have already learned everything I know. The night elf Faldron could offer you further training, however. Look for him in the Craftsmen's Terrace of Darnassus.
Welcome to our home, $N. Radnaal and I have little to offer, but you are welcome to what hospitality we can provide.
There's nothing I can teach you, other than maybe a better eye for color and detail. Talk to Simon Tanner over there; he knows a lot of advanced techniques for working with leather.
I already know a lot about style. Now it's just a matter of mastering the techniques for working with leather. Good thing Simon's a real sport about helping me learn them.
How's it going? I love the smell of leather; don't you?
Gosh, I'm sorry. I don't have anything new to teach you. How about you go talk to Simon Tanner in the Old Town section of Stormwind? He's a human with big muscles and dreamy red hair.
Since my husband left for the front, Helene here has been my strength. Her kind heart and sharp sword have helped me through a lot of tough times. I don't know what I would've done without her.
There are still lessons you must learn from others before my knowledge may be shared with you. Be diligent, and do not give up hope.
Your education is nearly complete. One final task is all that stands between you and the culmination of all your efforts...
I am proud. You are truly a gifted student. Now, for your final lesson...
Greetings traveler, you have my undying gratitude for dispensing with those dreadful creatures! I was beginning to think I might have to hide out forever!
Train hard, train every day. And when you have perfected your skills, return to me.
True mastery must be earned! It is up to you to earn it now...
There is only one whose skills exceed my own. You are ready to receive her knowledge. She is Annora, and you may find her... in Uldaman.
Have you come to seek the knowledge of Hgarth?
Your skills are truly becoming extraordinary. Now, let us continue your training...
You are eager, that is good. However, you are not yet ready to train with the likes of me.
To come this far has not been easy, I know. But how boring life would be without challenges, don't you think? Good, because I have a challenge for you...

You have nearly reached the pinnacle of your training. To become the greatest enchanter you can possibly be, you have one more instructor to seek out. Her name is Annora, and you may find her in Uldaman.
What brings you to the Tower?
Well done! You have that spark in your eye... I know it well, it's the same spark I had when I was but a pup! Now, let's see if I can't teach you something.
You are unfit to train with me, stranger. Spend some time with my assistant Jhag over there.
You may have what it takes. Let's find out!
Your skills are out of my league, stranger.Talk to Hgarth at the Sun Rock Retreat in the Stonetalon Mountains. He will provide you with more knowledge than I can.
Some adventurers think enchanting doesn't work. I find that when I challenge them to battle they change their tune!
Greetings, traveler! Care to delve into the mysteries of the arcane? Hm?
Well, I've seen better. But, you have potential, I won't deny it. Pay attention and you just might learn something!
No, no, you'll need FAR more training before you're ready to learn from me! Go talk to that uptight dabbler Malcomb Wynn. He's the one buried in books over there.
Hmm, you scratch my back, I'll scratch yours. If you do what I ask, and do it well, maybe we can discuss your training.

If I wasn't stuck here day in and day out, I would have attained the mastery required to train the likes of you! Unfortunately that's not the case. Go talk to Hgarth at the Sun Rock Retreat in the Stonetalon Mountains.
I don't get many visitors.  You're looking for something specific, yes?
Ah, very good. I am satisfied that you are a worthy student. Now, your training with me may begin...
Surely Mot didn't send you to me? He knows better. You are not yet capable of understanding what I would teach you. See my son Mot, just outside there, and finish training with him.
I will teach you... soon. I require a demonstration of your loyalty, first.
There is one whose knowledge exceeds my own. You are ready to seek her out. Go to Sun Rock Retreat in Stonetalon Mountains. Find Hgarth, and continue your training.
Enchanting has run in our family for generations. I learned at an early age, just as my son is doing now.
You have gone to great lengths, stranger, and you have my appreciation. I promised to further your training, and now I shall keep that promise.
I would be happy to teach you when you are ready, but that time has not yet come! I'm sure Lalina Summermoon will guide you until then. You may find her in the Craftsmen's Terrace in Darnassus.
Why don't we see just what you're capable of? If you complete the task I shall be happy to further your training!

I know many things, stranger, but your knowledge rivals my own. Enchanters who wish to hone their skills further are known to travel to the Tower of Azora, where an artisan named Kitta Firewind resides.
If you are seeking a truly rewarding pursuit, then a life of enchanting is for you!
You have not yet learned the basics, wanderer. Have you spoken to my assistant, Lalina Summermoon? Perhaps you should.
I believe you are up to this task... will you accept the challenge?
You are an exceptional enchanter. Beyond my talents as a teacher, I fear. Seek out Kitta Firewind at the Tower of Azora. Only she can qualify as your instructor now.
It is true I have skills to teach to those who are worthy. Would that be you?
You are not ready. Speak to Betty Quinn, she's standing by the stairs over there. Return to me when you have achieved a higher enlightenment.
You seem confident. Surely you wouldn't mind a test of your skills?

A true professional know his limitations, and I'm not ashamed to admit that your skills exceed mine. I want you to pay a visit to Kitta Firewind at the Tower of Azora. She is well-renowned, and with good reason.
If you have what it takes, I will be happy to show you the way.
You're joking, right? I believe you're looking for the OTHER short fellow, Thonys Pillarstone. He's downstairs. Now skedaddle!
Great, let's get started... ha! Fooled you! Surely you didn't think it would be that simple. You'll need to prove your mettle just like everyone else!
What do I look like, the Grand Poobah of enchanters? Your skills require the guidance of an Artisan! Go find Kitta Firewind at the Tower of Azora.
Who are you? What do you want from me?
To die in battle is glorious! But, with what I teach you, maybe you not die so quickly, hm?
You come to wrong place. Talk to the expert Godan over there. You learn more from him.
Throm-ka! What you looking for, stranger?
I cannot teach you anything you don't already know. However, the knowledge of my father far surpasses my own. Go inside and speak to him. Good luck!
What I wouldn't give to be out on the open plains on a day like this... but, my duty binds me.
You don't look like much to me, but who knows, maybe there's an enchanter hidden in there somewhere!
Eh, well you've made it this far... go see Lavinia Crowe by the other bookshelf there. If you don't mess things up with her, maybe you can learn some more.
I do not have time to waste, stranger. State your business or be off!
Open your mind, wanderer, and we shall begin.
You have truly excelled in your knowledge of enchanting. There is much more to learn, if you are willing. Speak to Taladan, in the Craftsmen's Terrace in Darnassus.
Elune's secrets are many, but they are not to be shared with just anyone.
I will teach you what I can. Each lesson is a gift from the Goddess herself. Use her gifts wisely, and you shall not falter.
Your skills are beyond my reach. It is time for you to face new challenges. Taladan will help you prepare. He is standing by the table there.
The Goddess has granted me wisdom, stranger. If it is her will, I shall pass it on to you.

Ye're a fine enchanter indeed! Now it's time fer ye to move on. I want ye to talk to Gimble Thistlefuzz, upstairs. He's a bit of a character, but he'll steer ye in the right direction from here on out!
There are ways to strengthen steel beyond the hammer and forge, young wanderer. Care to learn more?
Hmm... well you seem capable enough. If you truly desire to learn, then nothing will stand in your way! I will guide you through your first steps on what I hope will be a long and fulfilling path.

I'm afraid I have nothing to teach to someone with your experience. But you haven't reached the end of the road yet. Speak to Lucan Cordell, behind the counter there. He'll guide you through the next phase of your journey.
Hail, traveler! What brings you to my doorstep?
Show me what you got! You won't be sorry, I promise!
Well my friend, you've reached heights some people only dream of. Congrats! And now, without further ceremony, it is time for your final lesson!
I've been working on a way to transport oil underground between major cities, but everyone tells me it's a pipe dream.
Nice going! I knew I was right about you, no matter what those other people said. Ha! I'm kidding! Okay, on with your lessons...
Nice try, but you'll need some more experience before training with me! Back to the trenches!
I think you're more than qualified for this little assignment... let's see if I'm right!
I can't teach what I don't know! If only there was someone else who knew more than I do... wait, there is! Go see Buzzek Bracketswing in Gadgetzan!
Sometimes I surprise even myself!
The things I would teach you would turn your brain to jelly! Come back when you've learned sufficiently!
Not that I doubt your abilites, but I would like you to perform a task for me. Call it a demonstration of good faith...
You have certainly come a long way in your training. There is only one instructor who can train you further. Find Buzzek Bracketswing in Gadgetzan!
If my calculations are correct, the wheel will soon be obsolete!
Well... you almost impressed me. I suppose I could spare the time for a few lessons...
This is a waste of time, mine and yours! Go see Graham Van Talen if you want to begin your instruction! He's standing to my left over there.
Let's see how competent you are, shall we? If you perform this task to my liking, I'll spend the time to teach you!
What do you think I could teach you? Roxxik would do a much better job. You can find him in Orgrimmar. Now be off!
I don't have time for idle gossip, I'm a professional!
You have passed your test, well done! Your training may now continue.
You have not yet earned the right to train with me. See Thund first, over by the table. Come back when he says you're ready!
Every day is a test, and this day is no different. If you pass this test, I will share some of my knowledge...
You have earned the privilege of training with a higher instructor. Go see my pal Roxxik there.
If there were just a few more hours in a day...
Close, but no cigar! I'm afraid you'll have to talk to my sis, Jemma first. After she's gone over the basics with you, come see me and I'll show you the juicy stuff!
You'll need to prove your worthiness before I go giving away my secrets! I've got just the test for you...
Don't tell anyone else I said this, but even I don't know everything! If you want to keep learning, you should talk to the owner of the shop, Springspindle Fizzlegear.
The plans for my twenty-foot tall turkey baster are nearly complete! Now all I need is a twenty-foot tall turkey...
You can learn from me in time... but not yet! Why don't you start out by talking to Sprite Jumpsprocket to my right here. You can check in with me after you've gotten your feet wet!
Quid pro quo! I'll teach you what I know, but first I want you to perform a small task...
Well, you're just zooming right along! I can't teach you anything you don't already know, but Springspindle Fizzlegear sure can! You can find Springspindle in Ironforge. Good luck!
Let's see... fourteen plus seven, carry the two... oh, yes?
Fantastic! Aren't you the industrious one? Well, let's get started, shall we?
Hmm... well, I can't help you quite yet! You have to learn the basics first. Why don't you go see Sprite Jumpsprocket in Stormwind!
I can show you a few tricks... if you don't mind doing a little something first, that is.
You're working your way up... higher than me, at this point! You should talk to Springspindle Fizzlegear in Ironforge! (He'll? She'll?) show you more than I ever could!
I'm never too busy to speak to a stranger! Almost never, anyway...
Engineering will provide you with the skills and knowledge to dismantle your opponents! Let me show you how...
You are ready for greater things! See Franklin Lloyd, to my right. He will guide you from now on.
The Dark Lady has said that knowledge will be our greatest weapon in this war.
You know who's really smart? Nogg! Smarter than me, even. You go tell Nogg Thund sent you! You can find him by the control panel over there.
Who says Orcs aren't smart? It takes a lot of brains to be an engineer!
I know a few things. You want me to show you?
You know who can really show you some things? Nogg! You go find him in Orgrimmar.
I like to build stuff. Of course, I like to blow stuff up even more!
A fellow enthusiast, huh? Well, you just wait, we'll make a gearhead out of you in no time!
I'm afraid you're out of my league, friend! You should go see Nogg in Orgrimmar, he'll take you to the next level!
(Sniff, sniff) You smell that? Don't you just LOVE the smell of grease?
Yeah, I'll show you a few things. We'll see how you do, maybe you'll surprise me!
I can't help ya'! You're ready to see someone who's been at it longer than I have! Let's see... you're an Alliance type, so you need to talk to Lilliam Sparkspindle in Stormwind.
What? You want something?
This kind of work isn't for the faint of heart. I have an uncle who lost a hand! Poor old Stumpy... anyway, if you're still interested I might be able to show you a few things.
You need to start learning things that are beyond my expertise! Talk to Lilliam Sparkspindle in front of the tent there. He'll set you on the right course!
Ah, what a beautiful day to blow something up!
You want to train? With me? Fantastic! The only thing better than assembling bullets and explosive devices is to share that knowledge with someone else! Let's get started!

Oh, you've got oodles of things to learn still. I would teach you everything if I could, but I'm still learning too! Why don't you talk to Trixie Quickswitch in Ironforge, she'll help you further your education!
Hello there! My name's Jenna! And you?
Well... I hate to admit it, but my sister's the one you'll have to talk to if you want to continue training. I don't know as much as she does... yet! She's standing over by the rocket car.
I heard the new Henweigh 6000 will be rolling off the assembly line soon. I can barely contain my excitement!
I would be delighted to aid you in the commencement of your pursuit! Let me grab my spinner and we'll get started...
Your current aptitude exceeds my instructional capabilities. You should enquire further with my fellow Gnome Trixie Quickswitch in Ironforge!
Where's my spinner? I just had it here somewhere...
Lookin' to be an engineer, eh? Well, by Muradin, ye've come to the right place!
I would train ye if I could, but ye need the services of someone a bit more... what's the word? Brainy! Look for Trixie Quickswitch in Ironforge. Tell 'er Bronk sent ye!
Just a minor adjustment here... ah there we go!
Argh, the pain. Will it ever leave me?
Ah, $gpriest:priestess;, you came along just in time. I appreciate it.

How dare you ask me for training, maggot? What were you hoping for, you slack-jawed yokel, a lecture on the proper uses of silverleaf? Out! You're lucky I don't thrash you senseless for wasting my time.
Hmm, well, I can see that you have a little skill at making potions. Whether you're worthy to be my student remains to be seen, however. I have a job for you. Impress me.
Don't stir the potion like that, you ham-handed farmer! No, don't stop stirring it, either! Forget it--just give me that ladle before you start a fire. I'll salvage what I can. Now, pay attention.

Warchief Thrall himself asked me to come out here. I was honored to obey, and it's no hardship. I couldn't have asked for a better posting than Stonard. Just about any herb I might need grows in the muck here.
Kalaran, I have misplaced my torch. I require another.
Elune has seen fit to gift me with skill and experience. Now I shall pass them on to you.

Have you come here for instruction in the art of making potions? You were mistaken if you thought that I would offer such a privilege to you, unearned. Go, and do not return to me until you have greater skill.

Once I welcomed darkness, for it was the sister of night. Now it is dark all the time, even during the day, and the forests cry out for sustenance. Unless we act soon, this spreading blight will cover the world.

You don't yet have the skill to study with me. Go talk to Doctor Martin Felben over there, or go up the ramp to the southeast and see Doctor Marsh. They are Forsaken who can give you the training you need.
You've got real talent and a passion for making potions. There is one little matter I'd like you to take care of, though.

Incredible. Your potions display a knowledge that rivals my own. I cannot train you further, but talk to the orc Rogvar of Stonard in the Swamp of Sorrows. He's known for his cutting-edge experiments.
My colleagues and I are gathering the deadliest substances we know and testing their effects on our enemies. Once I have everything I need, I shall brew such plagues as this world has never seen.
Your skill at brewing potions needs to be greater before you can become one of my students. In the meantime, perhaps Sylvanna Forestmoon or Milla Fairancora can help you, just over there.
This is excellent work. Are you ready to undertake a mission on my behalf? I know of no one more qualified.
It is time you moved on to a more advanced teacher. In the Feathermoon Stronghold of Feralas dwells the night elf Kylanna Windwhisper. She has a brilliant mind; doubtless she can train you further.
This potion seems to heal less damage every time I brew it, though I use the same ingredients. There can be only one conclusion: the plants are changing. I cannot say why or into what.

I'm not amused by your audacity in coming to me for training. Go through the archway and down the ramp to the southeast, and talk to Doctor Martin Felben. He is a Forsaken who can teach you the basics.
If you seek to become my student, you'll need to complete an assignment for me. Prove yourself worthy, and I might even consider rewarding you.
I have no more knowledge to bestow upon you. Go through the archway and down the ramp to the southeast, and talk to Doctor Herbert Halsey. He is a Forsaken who can teach you more advanced techniques.
With Algernon to keep me supplied, I can do all my work here without hunting for a single herb. If I never have to see the wonders of nature again, it won't be too soon.
My powers have returned and you have squandered your chance, foolish mortals. Till we meet again.

Another student. Wonderful. This is why Lydon belongs to the Royal Society of Snobs and gets to do research, and I'm stuck being an instructor. If I win another teaching award, I'll never live it down!
Don't waste my time. I have research projects older than you. Go talk to Doctor Martin Felben in the Apothecarium of the Undercity. He's a Forsaken who can probably manage to teach you the basics.
If you're going to be taking up my time, you'd better prove you're worth it. I ought to get something out of this arrangement, after all.
Me, train you? Come on--we both know I can't. It's this teaching, you see. My own skills suffer. You want training, go to Doctor Herbert Halsey, a Forsaken in the Apothecarium of the Undercity.
Another interruption. How am I supposed to get any work done like this? Don't answer that; do I look as if I care what you have to say? Why don't you go bother Mr. High-And-Mighty instead?
You have some skill, it is true, but every moment I spend teaching you is one more moment the undead will spend in torment. Prove to me that you are worth my time.
I cannot in good conscience spend time training novices while our allies, the undead, are suffering so terribly. Please speak with Kray over there instead; he can help you for now.
Can you not sense the anguish of the Earth Mother for her lost children, the undead? Speak quickly, $N. Every second costs me dearly. We must help them find their way back to her!
When I first saw the undead, I wept, for I could not imagine their horror and loneliness. The Earth Mother spoke to me then; she sang in my blood. And she told me, "Save them."
You're better at this gig than I am! You want someone with even more experience than I've got. That'd be Ainethil, a night elf lady who lives in the Craftsmen's Terrace of Darnassus.
Herbs are so pricey! I could always use a little something extra, if you know what I mean. Help a goblin out?
What is this? You trying to ruin my reputation? I don't teach novices, $gbuddy:lady;. Try talking to the orc Whuut in the Drag of Orgrimmar. He's a lot closer to your level of skill. And brains.
I've got plenty of great recipes for you to take a look at, and at discounted prices, too!

Glyx and I have an understanding: he keeps me supplied, and I keep him rich. Seriously! What that pirate charges me for a measly pouch of crumpled kingsblood... it's enough to make a grown goblin cry.
You're talking to the wrong orc. I don't train novices. Talk to young Whuut over there... and use small words.
I've been looking for a little help. Since you've got the skill, I guess you'll do, provided you've also got the guts.
I'm honored to meet you, $N, but your skill at potions is greater than my own. Go see Doctor Herbert Halsey, an undead in the Apothecarium of the Undercity. He can help you from now on.
I'm busy, $N. Tell Whuut to handle whatever it is. That young pup has been stewing all day long. He spends much more time like that, and he's going to hurt something.
Ah, to be young again, and to have discovered potions for the first time. Thank you for refreshing my memory, $N. Now go share that youthful enthusiasm with Milla Fairancora over there.
Your skill is not inconsiderable. Since you appear to have sufficient experience, there is a matter in which I require your aid.
My skill at creating potions is inferior to yours. You are ready to speak with Ainethil, just over there. She will understand that you are ready for further instruction.
Even slight alterations to a potion's ingredients can change it fundamentally. Patience and precision, young one: they will serve you well in all walks of life.
You have learned the fundamentals of making potions, but further study requires greater commitment. Prove your dedication by carrying out a task for me.
My apologies, $N, but I do not offer instruction to novices. Instead, talk to Milla Fairancora in the Craftsmen's Terrace of Darnassus. She can help you make up for lost time.
Teaching is not a one-sided trade, $N. As I teach you, I learn more myself, and my understanding grows.
Ishnu-dal-dieb, $N. Have you come here in search of knowledge?
That's nice, $N. Go show whatever it is to Vosur over there. He'll answer any questions you have.
Hey, that's actually not so bad. Alrighty, then. How'd you like to run an errand for me?
Um, you already know everything I could teach you. Maybe it's time for you to talk to someone else. Try the night elf Ainethil in the Craftsmen's Terrace of Darnassus. She's got some real talent!
Don't let the beady eyes and bushy beard fool you. Vosur's a talented apprentice and a good friend, even if I do get a crick in my neck when I talk to him.
You've put in your time studying the basics. Now it's time to up the ante.
I'm sorry, $N, but I have no time to spend on novices. You want someone closer to your own skill level. Try the night elf Milla Fairancora, in the Craftsmen's Terrace of Darnassus.
There's nothing more I can teach you. I've heard of a night elf who might be able to, though. Her name is Ainethil, and she lives in the Craftsmen's Terrace of Darnassus.
Stop giving me that look. I may not be an adventurer like you, but that doesn't mean I can't have a few muscles. All that stirring makes your arms strong.
Very well. Cut another lump of flesh from one of these specimens. Let us test what you've learned so far, and we can progress from there.
Once, it is true, I was human. What might otherwise be a shortcoming works to our advantage, $N, for I know human weaknesses intimately.
Here to learn about potions? I've got plenty to teach you. I might be dead, but I haven't lost my brains. Yet.

Nice to see a friendly face. I don't get much chitchat from Apothecary Johaan unless he wants something. He's been out of the grave too long. Someday I'll be like that, I hear. Creepy. Maybe by then I won't care.
I must have broken hundreds of vials when I first began brewing potions. The glass was so fragile in my clumsy hands. I hope you are more cautious than I was.

Bena works like one possessed. Day and night I have seen her bent over these potions, often going without sleep or food. I know our undead allies need help, but I begin to fear she will do herself an injury.
They called me stupid, but I'll show them. I'm going to watch every pot I have and prove that they can all boil stuff anyway. Yeah, I'm on a roll! Who's stupid now, huh? Huh!?
All the bottles on this table are potions I brewed today. And they say a watched pot never boils. Ha!
You got questions, but they be too big for me to answer, $N. You be needin' to have words with the orc Yelmak in the Drag of Orgrimmar. He'll help you out.
Ready for another lesson? All right, then. First, relax. You gotta stay loose to stir a potion just right.
You got the look of someone wantin' adventure. Me, I had enough of that by the time we trolls came here. Now I take each day as it comes, an' I train other folks to handle adventures for me.
Put your back into it, $glad:lass;. Hard work and determination--that's the way! Don't let anyone tell you book learnin' is all ye need.

Don't let those big, innocent eyes fool ye. Tally's an expert, all right: I learn something new every day. Why d'you think I'm here in Tinker Town? Do I look like an engineer to you? Aye, I didn't think so.
I don't suppose you're here to talk about my lovely Kali. Fine, then. Potions it is. Anyone ever tell ye you've got a one-track mind?
Did my sweet lass Kali send you down to me? The apple of my eye, she is.
Is it not astonishing what one can create from the plants of the forest? Truly, Elune has blessed us with her bounty.
Elune-adore, my $gbrother:sister;. You are welcome here. Speak, and I will do what I can to aid you.
Unfortunately, there is little I can teach someone with your experience, my friend. Seek out the night elf Sylvanna Forestmoon, who resides in the Craftsmen's Terrace of Darnassus.
Well done! Your understanding of potions is coming along nicely.
The druids say that it is only a matter of time until nature itself drives the Horde from Kalimdor. Yet corruption continues to spread throughout our lands, even here on Teldrassil.
I am honored to share my knowledge with you, $N. See that you use it well.
Shut inside this little house, I dream of joining the battles that rage outside the city walls. Still, duty compels me to share my knowledge with others who fight in my stead... for now.
You've made a good start, but you still have a great deal to learn, $N.
Good day, $gsir:ma'am;. I'd shake your hand, but as you see, I'm in the middle of something. May I be of assistance?
You challenged us and we have come. Where is this master you speak of?

We, his sworn servants, do his bidding and enforce his iron-rule. Cut off from the energies of his fiery realm, Ragnaros is but a shadow of his true self. However, he has more than enough strength to be your end.
What else do you have to say?

A mere three hundred years ago, a reckless dwarf named Thaurissan summoned the master from his fiery realm. His return to this paltry world devastated the surrounding lands and created this volcanic Core. Mighty Ragnaros has slept under this mountain ever since.
I need a ride, fast!  I have an important message to deliver!
Da spirits be strong wit you, mon. What kin dis troll do for ya?
The spirits have guided you to me. How may I be of service?
Teach me the ways of the spirits.
Wot kin I do fer ye?
Do you prefer guns or bows?
Tell me more.

The Firelord and his brethren once held sway over this entire world, mortal. As a servant of the Old Gods, he fought against the Titans for domination of this planet. The victorious Titans banished my master and his brethren to the Elemental Plane - there to remain imprisoned until the end of time.
I seek training in the ways of the Hunter.
Yes. I have.
While Theramore is reknown for it's exceptional training of warriors, I am afraid that I can not help you.
Due to incompatibility on your class specification, I am unable to help you rectify any situation you have with lack of ability.
Take it easy, mon. I only train da warriors.
I'm Augustus!  You want it, I got it!  You wanna sell it, then I want it!
I'm Augustus, and my prices are INSANE!
You won't find better prices anywhere!
Greetings, $c. Please be brief in how the Kirin Tor may be of service to you.
Yes, Augustus.  I would like to do business.
Commerce!  I crave it!
Before the Scourge came, I had a great business.  I bought and sold everything.  Everything!$B$BAnd my prices were INSANE!$B$BJust ask anyone.  Anyone who's not dead.
May Cenarius watch over you, $g brother : sister;.$B$BI am Tajarri, and I am a sworn protector of this shrine.  It is my honor to serve Keeper Remulos as a warden of this sacred land.

The Shrine of Remulos is a sacred place for us in the Cenarion Circle here in Moonglade... so please conduct yourself in a manner befitting a visitor.$B$BA visitor who doesn't want my scimitar buried in them, that is.

After the makrura attack, we could see that the Gallant would not survive another.  So I and the few surviving sailors abandoned my ship.$B$BWe are now ashore and will soon strike out for the town of Nijel's Point, but much danger lies between us and sanctuary, and I fear Desolace will consume us.$B$BI write this now in hopes that someone will know our plight, and some day avenge us against the watery fiends who were our ruin.

My chest is one of ingenious design, and requires two keys to unlock, one gold and one silver.  The first key, the silver key, I gave to my first mate, and I kept the gold.$B$BBut we were doomed to lose them.  My key was lost during the next naga attack, and my first mate's was lost a day later when drysnap makrura assailed us and pulled him into the deep.$B$BI am sure the naga and makrura have the keys.  I am glad the two are enemies and will not share them.
Continue reading...
Let's take a look at your fishing supplies.
The presence of blue dragons.
The Timbermaw furbolgs.
If I should fall, take my pouch. Make certain that it gets to the High General.
These orders must get to High General Abbendis!
I sense danger up ahead.
The mage tower to the north.
The Ruins of Eldarath.
The land of Azshara.
You've interfered with our plans for the last time, foolish $c!
If you're looking for a flight back to Rut'theran Village, then you should talk to my night elven counterpart, Silva Fil'naveth.
You're not a druid!
If you're looking for a flight back to Thunder Bluff, then you should talk to my tauren counterpart, Bunthen Plainswind.
Would you like a flight to Rut'theran Village, courtesy of the Cenarion Circle?
I'd like to fly to Rut'theran Village.
I just finished wandering.
[PH] Ok, I'm outta here... see you in Ragnaros' Lair... l8
Please train me.
The flutter of the wings of a hawk, the breath of a ram in the snow, the pace of a bear through the forest... Such is life for the hunter.
I am here for training.
If you're here to be trained in the tactics and strategy of hunting, you've come to the right place!
I wish to train.

Remember, all things are connected. If the beasts were gone from the land, our kind would die from a great loneliness of spirit, for whatever happens to the beasts also happens to the Tauren. Whatever befalls Azeroth befalls all those that inhabit it.
I seek training to ride a steed.
I'd be wasting both your gold and my time if I were to teach you how to pilot a Mechanostrider, $c.  You're just too large!
You need to be friendly with the Forsaken of the Undercity before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
You need to be friendly with the gnomes of the Gnomeregan Exiles before I will teach you how to pilot a Mechanostrider, $c.
You need to be friendly with the night elves of Darnassus before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
You need to be friendly with the humans of Stormwind before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
You need to be friendly with the tauren of Thunder Bluff before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
You need to be friendly with the trolls of the Darkspear tribe before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
You need to be friendly with the orcs of Orgrimmar before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
You need to be friendly with the dwarves of Ironforge before I will teach you a riding skill, $c.
I can teach you the finer points of Raptor Riding, provided you have enough gold to cover the lesson!
I can teach you the finer points of Tiger Riding, provided you have enough gold to cover the lesson!
I can teach you the finer points of Mechanostrider Piloting, provided you have enough gold to cover the lesson!
I train and guide young hunters in the traditions passed down many generations.
I'd like to train.
Come learn the ways of the hunter. Pride, honor, and tradition.

On behalf of the Royal Apothecary Society, I am pleased to offer you the finest steeds available for the Forsaken.  These beasts have endured trials and tribulations as we all have, and now they too have emerged stronger and more resilient than mere mortal flesh would have had them destined to be!  Please, inspect them for yourself and see.
The Royal Apothecary Society has little patience for fools, as do I.  Perhaps the next time you and I speak of my steeds, you will be considered a friend of the Undercity.  Until then...
I am a hunter and wish to train.
Tauren have a passion for hunting; it is something that runs deep with our kind.
I am in need of training.
I train hunters in the ways and traditions of our ancestors.
I have come for training.
I have much knowledge to impress upon you, $c. You must learn to hunt with honor.
Let me train you in the ways of the hunter.
Welcome to the Cenarion Circle, $c.

Kodo beasts, my friend!  Trained from a young age and raised on the Golden Plains of Mulgore, these fine animals will make even finer steeds!  Please, browse my selection, and see for yourself why we taurens have come to rely on these magnificant creatures!
Before beginning a hunt, it is wise to ask someone what you are looking for before you begin looking for it.

You are not known to my people.  A kodo is a mighty steed, and it is the product of love and care by my people; such is not given onto strangers.  Until the elders of Thunder Bluff consider you to be a friend, I cannot offer you the sale of a kodo.

Years of quality breeding techniques and plenty of care allow me the privilege of showing you these horses!  Please, take your time as you consider them for your mount.  A horse is a companion for the ages, friend.  Don't sell yourself short - get your steed here today!

Sorry, but I am not disposed to sell horses to any individual who is not considered to be at least friendly to the Kingdom of Stormwind.  These steeds are the finest you'll find anywhere, and we certainly wouldn't want them in the hands of our enemies.$B$BNot saying you're an enemy, of course... just earn the trust of Stormwind and then we can do business.

You've not had a steed until you've taken the reigns of a finely bred Barak Tor'ol mountain ram, my friend.  Please, feel free to inspect these fine companions to any adventurer.  They'll serve you well, believe me.
I am curious to see what a bucket of bolts has to offer.

Not so fast, $g guy : lady;... I'll not be handing out the reigns of a mighty ram steed to someone that's not a proven ally of the dwarves of Ironforge.  Once you've been recognized as friendly to Ironforge, I'll gladly show you what varieties of rams I have for sale.
Yes, I have. Teach me.
Come to learn from the master eh?
Can you train me how to use rogue skills?
I'm lookin' for rogue trainin'.
Let me take a look at what you have to offer.
Greetings young rogue. What do you seek?
I seek training.
Good boy! Now put it back on the bone pile.
I am unable to train you.
Redpath!  Your life ends, here and now!
Go get it!!
Are you ready to fetch, boy?
Thanks again, $n! I'm very pleased with what we found.$B$BGood luck to you!
We work to preserve the balance as Cenarius teaches, $c.  His is the light of a beacon that shows the way for us, and we must do everything in our power to preserve that light.
You merely prolong the inevitable, $r. Succumb. She will free your misguided soul.

Even within cold, stone walls such as the ones that shelter this town, one may find tranquility and peace.  In fact, you may find them everywhere you are... simply look inside yourself for such balance.
Our master Malfurion remains lost in the Dreaming, $c.  His is the light of a beacon that shows the way for us, and we must do everything in our power to preserve that light.
A darkness had fallen over my eyes, but you tore me from my unholy reverie.  You saved me, $N.$B$BAnd now I beg you... to forgive me.
The battle is over, and the people of Darrowshire are saved.$B$BThey are saved, $N, because of you.  You are truly a hero of Darrowshire.
The battle is over, and the people of Darrowshire are saved.
I seek training as a druid.
Strive to keep the balance in all things, $c.  This is where true harmony lies.
I have heard your words, Great Bear Spirit, and I understand.  I now seek your blessings to fully learn the way of the Claw.
I seek to understand the importance of strength of the heart.
I seek to understand the importance of strength of the body.

I represent the strength which bolsters you as a young druid.  I am the strength of the body, and the strength of the heart.  You have already come to know this in your training, and you draw upon this when you take on the aspect of the bear.$B$BContinue to keep the balance in all things, young one, and keep your perspective clear and true.  When you need me... I will be there for you.
What do you represent, spirit?
The bear looks at you calmy and patiently, but says nothing.
Let's find the next one, $N.
I need another Relic Bundle!
The Scourge are defeated!  Darrowshire is saved!

The spirit looks intently into your eyes and grasps your hand.  You feel a warmth shoot through your body, almost knocking you to your knees.$B$BAs the warmth passes, you feel the slight presence of an ursine spirit within your being... bolstering your resolve.
You have fought well, spirit.  I ask you to grant me the strength of your body and the stength of your heart.
I missed you too, honey.  And I'm finally home...
I missed you so much, Daddy!
Let's go play!  No, tell me a story, Daddy!  No... let's go pick flowers!  And play tea time!  I found my dollie, did I tell you?
Daddy!  You're back!
Daddy!
Hahah!
Pamela?  Are you there, honey?
The Nightmare is finally over!  Darrowshire, forgive me!
It... it is working!
$N, it is time for the final step; we must activate the altar.
We've found the it, $N.
Please, light this while I am channeling.
This blue light... It's strange, $N. What do you think it means?
Captain Redpath is slain!
Horgus is slain!  Take heart, defenders of Darrowshire!
Davil Lightfire has succumbed to his wounds!
Davil Lightfire is defeated!  Darrowshire is lost!
Remember, I need your help to properly channel. I will ask you to aid me several times on our path, so please be ready.
Ok, let's get going!
Too much time has passed. We must try again later.
Darrowshire, to arms!  The Scourge approach!
Darrowshire is defeated!  Soon, all of Lordaeron will fall!
Darrowshire!  You are doomed!
Defenders of Darrowshire!  Rally!  We must prevail!
Go back to your Lich King, foul creatures!
Fight to your last breath, brothers and sisters!
Fight, and we will win this day!
Do not give up!  Shed your blood for Darrowshire!
The Scourge will not prevail!
Fight!  Fight for your families!
Our captain will save us!
For Darrowshire!
Horgus, your nightmare ends!  Now!
Now is the time, Davil.  Now is the time of your death!
The Light burns bright in you, Davil.  I will enjoy snuffing it out!
Do not lose hope, Darrowshire!  We will not fall!
She'll have our heads if we're caught!
Don't let them catch you!
Get out of here!
TEST - restart battlefield.
For the Alliance!
Here I am, alliance!  Take me down... if you can!
It's Proudmoore! Get out of here!
Run!
Highlord Fordring, are you alright?
Hey, what's going on over there? Sir, are you alright? Sir??
NOOOOOOOOOOOO!
I will lead us through Heartghlen to the forest's edge. From there, you will take me to my father.
Such sssorrow... The passst cannot be undone...
I am ready for the illusion, Myranda.
These are dangerous times, adventurer. Walk lightly.
The Stormpike General is dead!
The Frostwolf General is dead!
Drek'Thar is defeated!  The Alliance is victorious... for now.$B$BSpeak with our quartermaster and aid in our reconstruction.
Neither generals is spawned.
The horde general is defeated!$B$BThe Alliance is the victor, and the Horde now scrambles to rebuild its weakened forces.
Our general, Vanndar Stormpike, has fallen in battle!  The battle is lost!$B$BSpeak with our quartermaster and help rebuild our forces.
Our forces are ready and eager.  Soon, Balinda Stonehearth will enter her outpost and the battle will begin anew!
Let's start a new battle, and beat the Alliance this time!
This is the Alterac Valley battlefield.  Currently both sides are at odds.
Let's start a new battle, and beat the Horde this time!
This is the Alterac Valley battlefield.  Both sides are still fighting.
Fresh troops flood to Iceblood Garrison!  Captain Galvangar will soon arrive, and a new battle will soon begin!
Captain Ballinda Stonehearth will soon arrive at her garrison.  A new battle will soon be joined!
It's done $N, and I think you'll be satisfied with the results.
The solution is ready in my cauldron.  It's just the matter of treating both the unfinished key and the scarab.
The Sarkhoff's... sometimes the Sarkhoff's visit. They are good people.
Are they all... dead?
Is someone there? Tirion my old friend, is that you? Have you come to save us?
I'm saved.
I am now corrupted.
If there is anything you would have of me...
So the Searing Blade is expendable?
It is good to see the Burning Blade is taking over where the Shadow Council once failed.
You may speak frankly, Neeru...

It would be wise to explain to you the depths at which our enemies will go to to hide themselves under our noses.$B$BKnow this first and foremost: our enemy is the Shadow Council. No matter what task I give you, or who I ask you to act against, know that one simple fact.$B$BMany cults exist within the Council, but only to hide its actions against the foolish.$B$BGroups like the Burning Blade, the Argus Wake, and the Searing Blade are all tools of the Council. Consider them one and the same.
The weapon master
Weapons Trainer
I am now corrupting you...
Next time, bring friends.
You weren't worth the energy expenditure. <Nathanos spits.>
Disappointing.
The reckoning is upon you, weakling!
How dare you!
I can smell your fear, $r.
I shall wear your entrails as a necklace.
Ah!  My wounds are too severe.  Defenders, fight on without me!
I will, Tirion.
That is terrible.
Thank you, Tirion. What of your identity?
I am ready to hear your tale, Tirion.

Do not presume to speak to me as though you are my equal, $c. Sylvanas is my queen, and I will do as she bids.$B$BIf you do not show the proper respect, I assure you, we can find a more than suitable place for you in the Nether.$B$BBut there is no reason we cannot have words if you wish to aid the Dark Lady...
Please, feel free to speak to me anytime, $N. You have served Magatha well. I am sure she will call upon you in the future.
Captain Redpath!  How could you forsake us!
I was devoured by Horgus!  I can still feel his teeth upon me!
Beware Marduk!  Beware, or your strength will wither.
The Light must prevail!
Do not fail us!
Oh, Darrowshire!  I would give a thousand lives for you!
You must save him!
End our suffering!
I just fired an arrow.
Who dares to challenge me in my domain?!
May I have another Dawn's Gambit, Betina?  I want to test it again...
When preparing the dragon's meal, be sure to torture the prisoner in view of the dragon.  It responds well to pre-meal entertainment.
From yesterday's field trip, Marduk showed us that the dragons will tolerate the meat of recently killed humanoids, but only if they died slowly and painfully.
We await a batch of black dragon eggs from the Burning Steppes.  We believe that, through their study, we will advance our knowledge dramatically.
Take note of the delicacy of the plagued dragon's diet.  Only terrified flesh will suffice.
Now if you turn to page 34 in your text, you see an illustration of a dwarf undergoing dissection...
I be a messenger from the Eastern Kingdoms, $N. I be sent here to make sure da priests who travel here be given proper direction.
I seek more training in the priestly ways.
Yes, $c?
You be watchin' yerself, $c. Respect our ways, or a curse be on you and yours.
I trust the Light is with you, $N. Is there something that I can I help you with?
Spot of tea, gov'na?
How dare you?!
I'm going to dust you into oblivion!
Time to take out the trash!
I don't get paid enough for this!
Welcome, $n! Are you interested in training in tailoring?
I have no time for you, $r. Continue on your way.
I trust very few of your kind, $N. But I can tell that you are a friend.
Please, do not bother me... Your kind is all the same...
What about the Winterfall furbolg?
How can I prove myself to the Timbermaw furbolg?
This land belongs to the Defias Brotherhood now!
I see those fools at the Abbey sent some fresh meat for us.
Greetings, $c.
Tailoring
Radnaal provides Nadyia with a good supply of leather from the animals he skins.  I recommend you speak with him if you wish to learn the profession.

What direction can I point you in?
Do you require guidance to your destination?

Anu therador mali $c.  Where can I guide you to?

Whatcha need?
Do ye need some help finding something?
Ye look a bit lost there.  Can I help ye find something?
Ye be needing directions $glad : lass;?
Inn
Are you new here?  Well, tell me what you're looking for then.
You look a little lost.  Who are you looking for?
Is there something I can help you find?
Hail citizen.  Do you need directions?
Say hello to my little friend.
Fordring shall never see his son.
Your blood spills for the betterment of humanity, infidel!
TEST - death after attack $N
TEST - death before attack $N
We need to get this wagon filled by the end of the day.  So back to work with you.  Chop, chop!
Daylight is still upon us so let's see that axe of yours chopping some more wood.

Race does not dictate honor, $r. While you remain on my farmstead, I ask that you remember and respect this credo.$B$BI have known orcs who have been as honorable as the most noble of knights and humans who have been as vile as the most ruthless of Scourge.$B$BBut I shall not bore you with tales of my youth! There is much work to be done - if that is what you desire.
Master Vectus, I sense something strange within this container...
Marduk, gather the box and place it before me!
Ah, so my minions from the Burning Steppes have brought the dragons...

Greetings, $c.$B$BThose Sentinels over there have allowed me to share their camp as long as I promise no trouble will follow--I am sure you can appreciate the need for diplomacy while here, yes?$B$BI am here investigating disturbances to the land, and since it aids their cause also, they have agreed that my presence here could only aid the tenuous alliance between all of Azeroth's races. If you wish to aid me, then I would appreciate it, but regardless, please try not to cause any trouble.
Join the fight against evil!  Accept a commission within the Argent Dawn today!
Onward, Crusaders! We must retake Corin's Crossing!
I need another Argent Dawn Commission.
Wake up!
Huh?  What do you want?
ZZzzzz....
Be on the alert! The Blackwood furbolgs are numerous in this area...
I am sorry. I am unable to help you at this time.
You must save us!
Tell me about the Cult of the Damned.
Yes I am.
Yes I do.
Ras Frostwhat? Who is that?
What is this plan?
Who do I need to kill?
This is disheartening. Is there anything I can do to stop this?
Impossible.
We must stop these villains!
If we fall, then Darrowshire is doomed!
Fight for your families!  Don't give up!
Where is the Silver Hand?  We need their help!
The Alliance has abandoned us!
Our captain has fallen!
Fight!  Fight for Darrowshire!
We must not give up!
All hope is lost!
Scourge will prevail!
Darrowshire will fall!
Our master wants you!
There is no hope!
Join us, or fall forever!
Your soul is doomed!
Hail the Lich King!

They don't realize that they're dead, $r. They are cursed to relive the last memory they had before the town was eaten alive from the inside out. Most of them, anyway. Some were less fortunate.$B$BYou thought the Scourge did this? The Scourge did not yet exist and if they had, we would have at least put up a damned fight.$B$BNo, this was the result of a plague that came out of Scholomance and ravaged the town. It was horrifying and devastating. None survived.$B$BNow leave me to my sorrows.
looks very sleepy...
As you inspect the cage and the Night elf inside, you get an odd sense of deja vu. For some reason she does not make eye contact with you--it is almost as if you are not there to her.

You've already done me a great service, $N. For that I thank you.$B$BThe least I can do now is tell you what brought me here: My long time friend Trey Lightforge and I came to Jaedenar to investigate the Shadow Council when they caught us unprepared. They took Trey deeper into Shadow Hold and put me in here after taking all of our equipment... I can still hear his screams from below, $N. They were... inhuman. I don't know what they've done to him, but they will pay for it.
You will pay for what you've done to Trey, $r!
You kept me in that cell for too long, monster!
You will not stop me from escaping here, $r!

So cold... and hungry.$B$BMy poor friend, I hope you've found peace. I can't stand to think about what they could have done to you.$B$BYou! You there! Please, you have to help me escape. One of them has a key, can you find it? I know they have it. If you get it, you can help me get out of here. Trey is probably already dead, but there's still time! Please, can you help me?
Eva, I have lost the Spectral Essence. I need another.
Can you help me with some directions?
Do I look like a guide to you?  Fine, what do you need?
What is it?
Yes?
You look like you're lost.
A profession trainer
A class trainer
The inn
The bat handler
The bank
Do you need something?
You look lost.  I can help.
Blessings of the Earth Mother upon you.
The wind rider master
The doctor is in!
Shaman
How can I help?
I feel sick.
This is an atrocity.
No restraints? Just in a circle?
Why didn't you just leave?
Until what, Eva? I must know.
The pleasure is mine, madam. Might I ask what it is that you are doing here?
Yes!?
Make it fast.
What do you need?
Lok'tar!  You look like you need help.
How are we doing in the battle to subvert the cauldrons?
We are dominating the Scourge - the effects of the altered plague will affect them for at least another full day!  We need to stay on top of it though, so be sure to sabotage a cauldron when you can.
We have begun to turn the Scourge's plague against them, but our hold is tenuous at best!  Be sure to aid the cause by subverting their cauldrons!
The Scourge's plague is almost to the turning point; a handful more cauldron subversions will push us over the top!  Be sure to do your part to help out!
We are having difficulty determining the status of the plague within the area; check back shortly and we may have a better idea.
Awake, ye servants! Defend the Disks!
I need a vitreous focuser.
Success is ours! The Ash'ari Crystal has been restored!
Our summoning is complete! The Ash'ari crystal has been restored!
This job is definitely not worth sixteen-five a year.
What's needed for the cauldron at Gahrron's Withering?
What's needed for the cauldron at the Writhing Haunt?
What's needed for the cauldron at Dalson's Tears?
What's needed for the cauldron at Felstone Field?
A fierce wind is coming - I can tell by the ache in my exposed knee.  I just hope we don't get caught up in it.
I wish to purchase arcane quickener from you.
The Light be with ya, $c. How can I help ya?
Spirits of the Highborne! You may now rest! The curse of the crystal releases you!
Cursed spirits! Let go of the past! The Crystal of Zin-Malor no longer binds you!
I require training.
An Ash'ari Crystal has been restored!
Okothos will train you, $N.
Borgosh! $N is ready to be trained.

When the work of a blacksmith reaches your level of expert craftsmanship, I present them with a choice.$B$BWhile you are not required to make a choice, it is recommended that you do - after all, do you want to be a neophyte forever? It is the artisan armorsmiths and weaponsmiths that supply our armies, win our wars and garner acclaim!$B$BBe warned, $N. Once a choice is made and the tasks required completed - there is no going back. One can only walk down one path.
